Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
Who We Are  



 

Claritas Rx is a digital health venture that brings clarity to the challenges of specialty biopharmaceutical products in the marketplace. In today's highly complex specialty networks, our mission is to illuminate the patient experience beyond the clinical trial. Claritas Rx leverages a proprietary technology platform and deep manufacturer expertise to automate and integrate channel, commercial, and clinical data and help biopharmaceutical companies generate actionable business insights. Our work uncovers the real-world variables impacting patient access, duration of therapy, and other metrics key to commercial success, making a real impact on patient healthcare.

 

The Position 



Claritas Rx has a nimble Silicon Valley start-up culture. We are looking to build a strong team of domain experts that can help scale a premier channel management solution. 

At Claritas Rx, Data Scientists work with our Customer Success and product teams to design, build, and deploy advanced analytics models to support our product and customers' business needs. Data Scientists also support Customer Success in analytics consulting engagements and develop custom features.  Claritas Data Scientists perform a range of activities that include data analytics, model building, presentation and delivery of results.  Our Data Scientists are active advisors to both our customers and our product team: they are data curious, enjoy analytical problem solving, are learning-oriented and enjoy coaching and collaborating with other team members to solve a variety of business problems. The ideal candidate for this position is a self-starter, intellectually curious, result-oriented and thrives in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment. 

Key Accountabilities

In collaboration with the Customer Success team, perform data analysis and reporting, create visualizations and presentations to answer business questions and support analytical consulting revenue
Collaborate with Customer Success and Product teams to productize and deploy analytical features and tools to enhance product value and meet customer needs
Learn and apply existing Department data science tools, methodologies, and processes to analyze and answer business questions
With some guidance from Manager or senior team members, complete work independently within reasonable timeline; Take initiatives to perform quality check to ensure the accuracy and completeness of work deliverables
Follow Department protocols and best practices in completing tasks and duties 
Contribute to the development of cutting-edge analytics solutions for our platform; leverage data science technologies, including machine learning, to build or improve patient journey predictive analytics tools and models
Maintain and improve core analytical data models and data science algorithms
Proactively research and study new techniques and tools to resolve challenges and improve outcomes

Required Qualifications

BS in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Analytics, Engineering, Operations Research, or other STEM fields, with 0-2 years' experience in analytics or data science function at pharma/biotech manufacturer, health tech start-up, or technology company
Able to apply statistical programming language such as Python and SQL to analyze large volumes of data to derive insights and produce data visualizations
Strong academic background in statistical concepts and methodologies, including but not limited to: statistical distribution, A/B testing, experimental design, hypothesis testing.  
Strong academic background in statistical modeling methods and techniques, including logistic regression, multivariate linear regression, variable feature selection
Solid understanding about relational data; able to exam, clean and transform datasets programmatically using Python and/or SQL for subsequent analysis and modeling
Good written and oral communication, able to clearly explain work process and logic to peers and supervisors clearly
Strong problem-solving skills and drive for success

Additional Preferred Skills and Experience

Academic background in computer science 

Education

Required:  BS in Data Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics, Business Analytics or other STEM fields.

Join Us 



We are seeking to add new expertise and perspective to our strong team of experienced professionals.  We aspire to a culture of accelerated professional development through, shared learning and collaboration; a respectful and fun work environment; and employee empowerment through the effective use of technology and tools.  

In addition to our great environment, we offer a salary between $75,000 and $110,000, benefits package and the opportunity to make a significant impact on a first-in-industry digital health solution.  Please send a cover letter along with your resume when applying to the position of interest.  Claritas Rx embraces diversity, equality, and transparency.  We are committed to building a team that comprises a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents.  We believe the more inclusive we are, the better we are.

Email careers@claritasrx.com

Title: Data Analyst - Insurance - REMOTE
Description:
Put your Insurance Experience to work - FROM HOME!

At WAHVE we value significant insurance experience and want to revolutionize the way people think about phasing into retirement by offering qualified candidates the opportunity to continue their career working from home. As we say - retire from the office but not from work. Our unique platform provides you with real work/life balance and allows you to customize your own work schedule while continuing to utilize your insurance expertise in a remote, long-term position which includes company benefits!

What You’ll Love About Wahve

We created a welcoming place to work with friendly and professional leadership. We are known for the great care we take with our staff and our clients. We are passionate and determined about delivering the best customer service, preserving insurance industry knowledge, and making a difference by the work that we do.

What We Are Seeking

We have assignments available to help our insurance industry clients in Data Analyst positions. Responsibilities include:


Build and maintain data warehouse, new reports, and ad hoc reports.
Work with user groups to identify reporting issues/enhancements and document business requirements.
Will serve as a member of a project team and/or work independently on projects.
Support and train internal users as needed.
Compile and prepare data for customer analysis.
Experience in C#, Visual Studio, JavaScript, CSS, and current web technologies such as .NET, ASP, JSON, and XML.
Experience with ANY of the following technologies: SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SSIS Reporting, Power BI, Dynamics CRM, Dynamics GP, Share point, Excel, Power Query, Power Pivot.
Ability to compile data results and author commentary on industry studies is a plus.
Insurance or financial services industry experience required. Current high demand for property CAT and AIR Catastrophe modeling skills.


TO BECOME A WORK-AT-HOME VINTAGE EXPERT, WE REQUIRE


25 years of full-time work experience
Experience working in a data analysis role in the insurance or financial services industry - required


Benefits Of Becoming a Wahve Vintage Expert


Health insurance based on eligibility.
401(k) with a 4% match.
Retire from the office but not from work.
Eliminate the office stress and the commute.
Choose the work you would like to do now.
Customize your schedule - full or part time.
Utilize your years of insurance industry knowledge.
Be part of our dynamic yet virtual team environment and connect with other experienced insurance professionals like yourself!


How To Get Started

Click APPLY NOW to complete our simple preliminary profile. Be sure to include your preferred contact information as one of our Qualification Specialists will connect with you promptly.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOU!

Title: Research Data Analysis
Description:
Proctor Foundation

Full Time

80993BR

Job Summary

The research data analyst will join a collaborative and exciting team of researchers at the F.I. Proctor Foundation studying infectious/inflammatory eye diseases in the U.S. and internationally. Researchers at the F.I. Proctor Foundation conduct clinical trials and large epidemiological studies on ocular inflammatory diseases which can cause blindness. The epidemiological studies involve large administrative databases and multicenter clinical trials involve domestic and international collaboration. This position requires an employee with excellent communication and organizational skills who can be relied upon to play an integral role in implementing research studies (including international clinical trials). The incumbent will be asked to contribute to study design from a methodological standpoint, help with database creation, management and analysis, as well as to assist in the writing of grants, progress reports, and manuscripts. The analyst will be responsible for writing and executing statistical analysis plans. Responsibilities will also include communication with and coordination of collaborating sites, and training investigators and study personnel. Travel to study sites may also be required for study implementation and monitoring.

The employee should show a strong interest in clinical research and a desire to contribute to the state of knowledge on the prevention, treatment and correlates of disease. The incumbent must be able to multi-task, problem-solve, and apply creative solutions to new and unexpected situations with limited supervision. The employee must be able to communicate effectively verbally and through written materials with collaborators.

The final salary and offer components are subject to additional approvals based on UC policy.

Your placement within the salary range is dependent on a number of factors including your work experience and internal equity within this position classification at UCSF. For positions that are represented by a labor union, placement within the salary range will be guided by the rules in the collective bargaining agreement.

The salary range for this position is $67,000 - $94,200 (Annual Rate).

To learn more about the benefits of working at UCSF, including total compensation, please visit: https://ucnet.universityofcalifornia.edu/compensation-and-benefits/index.html

Department Description

The F.I. Proctor Foundation for Research in Ophthalmology at UCSF is committed to engaging in research activities and providing state-of-art patient care that address infectious and inflammatory disease that cause blindness. The mission is the prevention of blindness worldwide through research and teaching focused on infectious and inflammatory eye disease.

Required Qualifications


BA/BS with a coursework in quantitative analysis (i.e. biostatistics, mathematics, computer science, statistics or related field; or equivalent experience / training.
Minimum of 1 year of directly related experience
Demonstrated proficiency completing complex statistical analyses
Knowledge of database management.
Knowledge of various study designs and implementation strategies.
Skills to communicate complex information in a clear and concise manner both verbally and in writing.
Demonstrated proficiency with statistical software packages (R, STATA or equivalent). R preferred.


Preferred Qualifications


Graduate degree in statistics, biostatistics, epidemiology or related field and/or two to three years of experience in practical data analysis or an equivalent combination of education and experience.


About UCSF

The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.

Pride Values

UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.

In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. Additional information about UCSF is available at diversity.ucsf.edu

Join us to find a rewarding career contributing to improving healthcare worldwide.

Equal Employment Opportunity

The University of California San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.

Pride Values

UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.

In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. Additional information about UCSF is available at diversity.ucsf.edu

Join us to find a rewarding career contributing to improving healthcare worldwide.

Equal Employment Opportunity

The University of California San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
En el área de Datos de Mutua Madrileña queremos incorporar un Business Data Analyst para la vertical de Auditoría Finanzas y Riesgos.




Como Business Data Analyst trabajarás codo con codo con expertos de negocio para el desarrollo de aplicaciones y activos de explotación que permitan maximizar sus capacidades y obtener un retorno claro y conciso




Funciones del puesto:

Identificar oportunidades para transformar datos en palancas de Negocio, y proponer, elaborar y defender business case con un driver económico.
Trabajar con los clientes internos en entender sus necesidades para diseñar e implementar las aplicaciones, visualizaciones y activos que se requieran basadas en las necesidades del negocio
Implementar y evolucionar aplicaciones que permitan operar y tomar decisiones de negocio de forma innovadora.
Evolucionar las capacidades de visualización y análisis de datos asegurando un diseño atractivo para el usuario




Perfil solicitado:

Formación universitaria
Necesaria experiencia en el sector asegurador/financiero y/o ahorro e inversión.




Competencias necesarias:

Habilidad para entender e interpretar los requisitos de los usuarios y convertirlos en habilitadores para transformar el negocio
Conocimiento, proactividad y curiosidad en generar valor a partir del análisis de grandes volúmenes de información.
Experiencia en creación o diseños de cuadros de mando.

Se valorará:

Experiencia en gestión de proyectos orientados a negocio
Experiencia en entornos de trabajo dinámicos (Lean) con objetivos concretos y con foco en la iteración con usuarios.




Además de la cualificación profesional buscamos personas con valores basados en la relevancia, la autenticidad y la superación para lograr los objetivos marcados.




Mutua es #ElLugarqueTeMereces




Aceptando suscribirse a esta oferta consiente el tratamiento de sus datos personales conforme a los términos y condiciones establecidos en: https://www.grupomutua.es/proteccion-de-datos/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mercedes-Benz Financial Services is the brand finance company of the Mercedes-Benz Group. Our goal? To offer mobility and financing solutions to all customers and lovers of our star.




We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales and Loyalty team. The objective is that through descriptive analytics and diagnosis, insights and recommendations can be generated that support better decision-making and help increase the conversion of the online channel.




For this reason you have to be able to work autonomously and that you like it. In addition, you have to be independent but in a highly collaborative environment. We are looking for a professional who is passionate and motivated by data and their work, ready to be challenged and challenged!




Responsibilities:




Perform a variety of analyses to discover audiences and behaviors in CRM, with the goal of finding and implementing new use cases.
Create audiences so that they can be used for A/B testing, CRM activations and even Paid Media.
Be able to define KPIs for the evaluation of marketing activations and verify that these measurements are technically possible
Evaluate the success of personalized actions and define the next steps due to learning.
Identification of Insights with clear commercial recommendations.
Be able to perform query Google Cloud.
Work as a team with the IT & BI areas to collaborate in the evaluation of data quality and build new data, tools, etc.




Qualification:




Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics or another degree with a strong analytical content
Total mastery of Excel, SAS and SQL (knowledge of other programming languages such as R or Python will be an asset)
English level B1.2 or above, with at least 3 years of experience in a comparable position, transforming data to extract key business insights using statistical/analytical concepts







Skills:




Independent, motivated, proactive and ready to take responsibilities to the next level
Be able to work in a team
Be an organized but adaptable and flexible person in the face of a dynamic and changing environment
Be eager to learn and understand the goals and needs of the business
Excellent communication skills, being able to translate the execution of technical data into insights and business recommendations
Customer-centric and problem-solving with communication skills that favor multidisciplinary work

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Data Analyst




As a data analyst, you will be part of the GIA data analytics team, which supports the audit missions and projects by providing data-driven insights and solutions




⚙ What will you do?

Collaborating with the audit teams to understand their needs and expectations, and to provide them with data analytics support and recommendations.
Collecting, processing and analyzing data from various sources and systems, using tools such as SQL, Power BI, Python, R, Tableau, etc.
Designing, developing and maintaining dashboards, reports and visualizations that communicate relevant and actionable information to the audit teams and stakeholders.
Identifying, assessing and monitoring key risks and controls, using data analytics techniques such as descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analytics.
Performing data quality checks and ensuring data integrity and reliability.
Staying abreast of the latest trends and developments in data analytics and sharing best practices and knowledge within GIA.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

A bachelor's or master's degree in data science, computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, or a related field.
At least 3 years of relevant experience in data analytics, preferably in an internal or external audit environment.
Strong skills in data manipulation, analysis and visualization, using tools such as SQL, Power BI, Python, R, Tableau, etc.
A good understanding of the audit methodology and the risk and control framework.
A high level of curiosity, creativity and problem-solving ability.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to work effectively in a multicultural and dynamic team.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
A willingness to travel occasionally, both nationally and internationally




🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Visualization Analyst
Description:
We offer:




• Join a best-in-class team that brings ideas, innovation and passion

• Work directly with senior management from various business units

• The ability to grow and shape your own career

• Collaborative creative environment

• Working on real business problems

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Partner extensively with other teams and business partners within and outside the department (such as sales, marketing, product owners, data science and data modelling) to deliver business solutions and support decision making

• Develop Tableau dashboards and data visualizations for reporting to senior management and business users including Financial Advisors

• Provide analytics and insight for various business initiatives and projects

• Utilize proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking to address challenges

• Build, monitor and review data models and conduct analyses based on specific requirements

• Establish strong work relationships with team members across Wealth Management functions to support strategic initiatives




You have:




• 0-3 years of business analytics experience or experience with digital tools

• Highly motivated, detail-oriented self-starter personality with a strong sense of ownership, willingness to learn, high degree of curiosity and desire to succeed

• Advanced written and verbal communications in English

• Strong analytical mindset

• Strong sense of identifying priorities

• The ability to handle multiple tasks and projects concurrently

• Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to determine business partner needs and create purpose built solutions

• The ability to work collaboratively across multiple business units, teams job functions and geographical locations

• At least Bachelor’s Degree




You preferably have:




• Data visualization experience (Tableau, QlikView etc)

• Experience with SQL, DataIku




Department Profile:




The Analytics & Data (A&D) organization is a key growth area within Morgan Stanley’s Wealth Management Division, playing a critical role in the execution of the wider Wealth Management strategy. The use of analytics and data will be a key driver in accelerating growth across all client segments, enabling data-driven decision making and delivering the best client experience.




About us:




Morgan Stanley provides a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, achieve and grow. You will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality.

Interested in flexible working opportunities? Morgan Stanley empowers employees to have greater freedom of choice through flexible working arrangements. Speak to our recruitment team to find out more.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximise their full potential. Our skilled and creative workforce is comprised of individuals drawn from a broad cross section of the global communities in which we operate and who reflect a variety of backgrounds, talents, perspectives and experiences. Our strong commitment to a culture of inclusion is evident through our constant focus on recruiting, developing and advancing individuals based on their skills and talents.

Title: Data Analyst - Tableau
Description:
Role Details

Data Analyst - Tableau Specialist
Day rate contract
Hybrid working – 4 days onsite in Dublin




Job Scope:

This role would be ideal for someone who enjoys working at the intersection of business and technology, using advanced data visualization tools to enable decision-making while also being comfortable with technical tasks like data modeling and SQL querying. The ability to communicate effectively with senior leadership is critical, as is the flexibility to adapt dashboards and reports to changing business requirements




Primary Responsibilities:




Business Analysis:

Lead projects like the Asset Catalog, working with the Infrastructure Data Engineering team.
Gather, translate, and document business requirements, ensuring they align with technical capabilities.
Collaborate with senior stakeholders to identify their needs and provide analytical solutions.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership in a clear and actionable format.

Tableau Development:

Design, develop, and maintain complex Tableau dashboards to facilitate data-driven decision-making.
Translate business requirements into visualizations that provide actionable insights.
Continuously optimize and enhance Tableau dashboards and reports to meet evolving business needs.

Data Engineering:

Support data engineering tasks such as refining data models to ensure they meet the needs of the visualizations.
Work with large datasets using SQL, and perform data manipulations as necessary to support dashboard development.

Key Skills and Experience:

Tableau Expertise: Advanced knowledge of Tableau, including dashboard creation, data modelling, and creating sophisticated visualizations.
Business Analysis: Proven experience in gathering and translating business requirements into technical solutions.
SQL Proficiency: Strong SQL skills for data manipulation and querying large datasets.
Stakeholder Management: Experience working with senior stakeholders and translating business needs into technical solutions.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with a high level of attention to detail.




This is a day rate contract role. Please apply if you satisfy the criteria above.

Title: Analista de Datos
Description:
Estamos en búsqueda de un Data Analyst con ganas de superarse día a día para uno de nuestros clientes finales más importantes del sector de energías.




RESPONSABILIDADES:




Administrar y dar soporte con herramientas de consolidación e informes utilizadas en finanzas entorno PowerBI para su correcto diseño, construcción y mantenimiento.
Analizar los flujos de datos en toda la organización e identificar oportunidades de mejora, al tiempo que brindar soporte a las líneas de negocio para garantizar que el sistema satisfaga sus necesidades comerciales.
Contribuir con habilidades técnicas (SQL, Azure ADF, Python, RPA) a las iniciativas de automatización.
Brindar soporte a FP&A, Control y otros líderes funcionales con informes y análisis ad hoc.




HABILIDADES:




Graduado en Ingeniería, Matemáticas y Estadística + Máster relacionado en Data.
+2 años de experiencia trabajando como consultor implementando herramientas de informes o como administrador del sistema de informes.
Conocimientos avanzados en PowerBI.
Ser una persona analítica, con habilidades sólidas para resolver problemas y analizar errores, orientado a resultados y con un enfoque estructurado en el trabajo.
Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y asumir un rol de gestión práctico.
Curiosidad intelectual, alta motivación y deseo de mejora continua.
Inglés: mínimo un C1.




CONDICIONES:




Banda salarial: 35.000 - 40.000€
Beneficios flexibles: seguro de vida, seguro de salud y tickets restuarantes.
Modelo de trabajo: Híbrido, 1 día de teletrabajo.




¡Si te ha interesado y estás en ese punto que quieres hacer un cambio en tu trayectoría profesional este es tu momento, así que no lo dudes y aplica!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community.

Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modeling, Finance, Risk Management, Operations and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the city center.

About The Position

Partner extensively with other teams and business partners within and outside the department (such as sales, marketing, product owners, data science and data visualization teams) to deliver business solutions and support decision making


Liaise with Technology partners to understand the data source and suggest enhancements as needed
Utilize proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking to address challenges
Build, monitor and review data models and conduct analyses based on specific requirements
Provide analytics and insight for various business initiatives and projects
Prepare and deliver presentations to highlight important metrics and showcase achievements
Create relevant documentation where needed
Support campaigns data creation for the data products and work on sizing of these campaigns
Collaborate with the broader team to merge the inputs from the machine learning models into the required analysis
Assist in the development of Tableau dashboards and data visualizations for reporting to senior management and business users including Financial Advisors


You have


3+ years data analytics experience
Bachelor's or higher degree in Business Management or Economics or IT or Data Science
Tech skills: hands on experience in SQL
Strong analytical mindset
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Detail oriented and ability to handle, prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously
Passion for providing help to navigate through complex decisions for clients
Experience in interpreting and creating data models and reports
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills
Great presentation skills


You might also have


Background in the Financial Services Industry, with an emphasis on wealth management
Experience working with technology teams closely
Experience in data modelling and visualization technologies, such as: Dataiku, Alpine, Snowflake, Python, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView, R


Interested in flexible working opportunities? Morgan Stanley empowers employees to have greater freedom of choice through flexible working arrangements. Speak to our recruitment team to find out more.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximise their full potential. Our skilled and creative workforce is comprised of individuals drawn from a broad cross section of the global communities in which we operate and who reflect a variety of backgrounds, talents, perspectives and experiences. Our strong commitment to a culture of inclusion is evident through our constant focus on recruiting, developing and advancing individuals based on their skills and talents.

Learn about our culture and the opportunities for professional growth at Morgan Stanley Budapest:

Build a career with impact. Visit morganstanley.hu or LinkedIn for more information.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and we are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to make sure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues, as well as the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Data Analyst

What you’ll have to do:


  • Drive the conception, implementation, and development of the BI reporting landscape. This includes understanding stakeholder business needs, drafting specifications and monitoring/reviewing implementation with the BI team;
  • Act as a business partner and advisor for the commercial and financial department. Some recurrent needs can be solved with the help of the BI team, while other custom solutions should be provided by us. This means accessing and processing the data in a way that answers those needs;
  • Present results in a well-structured, efficient, and clear manner;
  • Derivate strategic recommendations based on comprehensive data analysis;
  • Standardize processes and reporting for enhanced efficiency;
  • Prepare ad-hoc reports and draw conclusions related to profitability, deliveries, product availability, active promotions, inventory levels, etc. based on stakeholder requests;
  • Offer support on data gathering, consolidation and verifications within the finance team.



How we’d like you to be:

  • 1-4 years of professional experience in data analysis;
  • Extensive knowledge of Excel and writing SQL queries;
  • Basic to intermediate knowledge of Pandas (Python) is an advantage;
  • Intermediate knowledge of BI tools (Tableau) is an advantage;
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to work independently, with a focus on quality, detail, and accuracy;
  • Quick comprehension and ability to grasp new topics in detail;
  • Ability to describe complicated issues concisely and understandably;
  • High-quality standards for your own work;
  • Excellent spoken and written English skills.




What we’ve prepared for you:


  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Atlas psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • A friendly office. We redesigned our headquarter office to suit our hybrid work model: we doubled the number of meeting rooms and we equipped them with state-of-the-art technology.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Want to get ahead of the game?




We are actively seeking top talent to join our team and help drive our company's success.




As a member of our Data Analyst Talent Community, you will have the opportunity to:




Be first in line to be considered for future job openings within the company

Network with other highly skilled professionals in your field

Stay up-to-date on the latest industry trends and developments

Receive exclusive content from Randstad industry leading teams




We are searching for Data Analyst professionals to join our industry leading organization in The Netherlands and other European Countries to experience what it's like to work in a truly Human Forward company that puts people first, offering flexible working setups and highly competitive compensation, whilst also giving you the chance to grow and develop your skills to build for your best future.




If you're interested in learning more about advancing your career then please click to apply to join our Talent Pool...




We are an inclusive employer and should you require any reasonable adjustments in order to

complete any aspect of the recruitment process, please contact the Internal Talent Acquisition (ITA) team.

Title: Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS

You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.




You get even more bonus points if …

You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER

We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

INSPIRE SUCCESSFUL DECISIONS

Kantar’s Worldpanel division is searching for a curious, dynamic and creative graduate to join us as a Junior Data Analyst. Based in Lisbon, Portugal this is truly an incredible opportunity to be part of our exciting vision for the future!

The Team and Role’s mission

Are you passionate about decoding shopper behaviour and using data to answer tough questions? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can directly impact business strategies?

By joining our Global Analytical Development Teams as a Junior Data Analyst at Kantar Worldpanel, you'll work with the richest consumer panel dataset in the world, helping global clients understand and predict shopper behaviour across various markets, including FMCG, Tech, Beauty, and Fashion. We expect you to develop expert level data wrangling skills in R, SQL and Python which you’ll be expected to apply to our disaggregated datasets to create analytic solutions as well as having to actively developing Power BI Dashboards to help us tailoring compelling stories to our clients.

You’ll also be able to evolve in a variety of ways – as some of our Data Analyst have gone on to become Data Scientists, Data Engineers or even Project Managers that take on and lead challenging projects. With us, you’ll have the opportunity to develop your skills depending on business requirements and your interests, you’ll be able to progress onto learning and working with Angular, Databricks, Spark, Docker or Kubernetes. You could end up building front-end applications which help tell stories that our global clients will use to build their business strategies; or even using modelling techniques such as regression, decision trees and clustering.

If you're ready to make a meaningful impact on a global scale, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!

Key outcomes


Support various data-related projects across different departments, by working with diverse data sets to clean, manipulate, and analyse data using tools such as R and Python.
Conduct thorough data quality checks and ensure the integrity of the data.
Apply a range of statistical techniques and modelling processes to transactional and attitudinal data.
Understand industry best practices for data modelling to organise the data behind Power BI reports.
Develop and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards in order to translate complex data sets into easy-to-understand visualizations for stakeholders.


Key Capabilities

Your background will ideally look like this…


University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or equivalent fields.
Business proficiency in English (B2 Level Minimum Required).
Demonstrable experience with data analysis, either through academic coursework, projects, or internships.
Comfortable programming skills in R and/or Python will be required.
Experience or knowledge in SQL for database management and querying.
Familiarity with Power BI or other relevant data visualization tools.


With the following qualities…


A passionate learner willing to set aside hours each week to upskill yourself and progress quickly with the tools at your disposal.
Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrates a genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within different cultural and technical environments.
Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to comfortably connect with partners at all levels across the organization and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.


What Our Recruitment Process Looks Like...


1st Stage – Numerical Reasoning Assessment Test.
2nd Stage – Screening Interview with Talent Acquisition.
3rd Stage – Technical interview with Hiring Managers.


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!

At Sobi, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. We are dedicated to developing and delivering innovative therapies to improve the lives of people who live with a rare disease. Our edge comes from our team of people and our commitment to patients.

Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team:


Competitive compensation for your work
Emphasis on work/life balance
Collaborative and team-oriented environment
Opportunities for professional growth
Diversity and Inclusion
Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


Job Description

In this role, you will be part of a small, entrepreneurial, and agile global team that is focused on leveraging data, analytics and technology at scale to accelerate the growth of our core products in key geographies. We work closely and collaboratively, meeting at the office every working day to connect in-person, problem-solve, and iterate quickly to drive results.

You will have plenty of opportunities to collaborate with colleagues from around the world and make a tangible difference to help bring our innovative products to more patients faster.

Key Responsibilities


As a Data Analyst, you will be working with data from various sources across the company to continue to deepen our understanding of what drives the company’s performance, explore innovative angles to systematically look at & drive our business, and surface opportunities that will help propel Sobi’s growth journey.
You will generate insights with the potential to be leveraged at all levels of the organization – from CEO to business leaders in our affiliates globally.
You will also play an important role in designing & developing digital solutions to equip our field force, power their decision making and enable their agility, bringing your analytical work to life at scale across the company.


Reporting to: Analytics Manager, Strategy Implementation and Global Data & Analytics.

Qualifications

About you

As a person, you should be a team player driven to make a tangible contribution to the company, and be able to manage and prioritize between multiple workstreams depending on business opportunities which could change quickly.

You should be curious, eager to continuously grow and to constantly push the data & analytics envelope and help the company reach its next level(s).

In addition, you must demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership.


A top tier university degree in a relevant field (e.g. economics, business, science, or engineering)
Applicable work experience (1-3 years) from data analytics and data visualization (pharma/healthcare industry experience is a plus)
Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, advanced formulas, VBA)
A good understanding of how to perform data extraction and manipulation using a programming language (preferably R)
Proficiency with a visualization tool (preferably QlikSense)
Strong interpersonal and communication skills in verbal and written English (Swedish is not required)


Additional Information

Why Join Us?

Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team:


Competitive compensation for your work
Emphasis on work/life balance
Collaborative and team-oriented environment
Opportunities for professional growth
Diversity and Inclusion
Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


We are a global company with over 1,800 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.

We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.

Sobi Culture

At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.

As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

You will have plenty of opportunities to collaborate with colleagues from around the world and make a tangible difference to help bring our innovative products to more patients faster.

Key Responsibilities

  • As a Data Analyst, you will be working with data from various sources across the company to continue to deepen our understanding of what drives the company’s performance, explore innovative angles to systematically look at & drive our business, and surface opportunities that will help propel Sobi’s growth journey.
  • You will generate insights with the potential to be leveraged at all levels of the organization – from CEO to business leaders in our affiliates globally.
  • You will also play an important role in designing & developing digital solutions to equip our field force, power their decision making and enable their agility, bringing your analytical work to life at scale across the company.

Reporting to: Analytics Manager, Strategy Implementation and Global Data & Analytics.

Qualifications

About you

As a person, you should be a team player driven to make a tangible contribution to the company, and be able to manage and prioritize between multiple workstreams depending on business opportunities which could change quickly.

You should be curious, eager to continuously grow and to constantly push the data & analytics envelope and help the company reach its next level(s).

In addition, you must demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership.

  • A top tier university degree in a relevant field (e.g. economics, business, science, or engineering)
  • Applicable work experience (1-3 years) from data analytics and data visualization (pharma/healthcare industry experience is a plus)
  • Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, advanced formulas, VBA)
  • A good understanding of how to perform data extraction and manipulation using a programming language (preferably R)
  • Proficiency with a visualization tool (preferably QlikSense)
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills in verbal and written English (Swedish is not required)

Additional Information

Why Join Us?

Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team:

  • Competitive compensation for your work
  • Emphasis on work/life balance
  • Collaborative and team-oriented environment
  • Opportunities for professional growth
  • Diversity and Inclusion
  • Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments

We are a global company with over 1,800 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.

We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.

Sobi Culture

At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.

As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
About the role:

As a Data Analyst, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate closely with our dynamic teams and working on multiple tasks. You will play an important role in creating engaging and insightful data visualizations using Tableau, using advanced data analysis and modelling techniques to find valuable trends and patterns within our datasets. Your involvement in developing and maintaining data models, reports, and workflows will be crucial to our success. Furthermore, you will actively engage with various business units, gaining a deep understanding of their unique needs and creating customized dashboards and solutions to meet and exceed their expectations.




About the project:

Duration: 2-3 months

The project contains 2 parts of development:

The backend (data warehouse ) using the in-house data centre to develop a solution from data collocation to structured database (in storge ) ,
The frontend (visualisation ) : using the structured database in storge with the Tableau we cerate advance models flows in addition to build the dashboard visualizations.




What are the expectations/requirements?

You are already based in the Netherlands

Re-creation of existing dashboard and visualizations from PowerBI to tableau.

Creating data models from database using tableau Prep for visualizations

Creating new deep dives upon request

Interacting with multiple stakeholders to understand their requirements and implementing them in their dashboards

Gaid and support the stakeholders to understand and unlock the potential dashboard

Creating appealing dashboards and visualization, knowledge of UXUI would be nice




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the data solutions team to design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions
Create interactive and insightful data visualizations using Tableau
Perform complex data analysis and modelling to uncover trends, patterns, and insights using Tableau prep and SQL.
Assist in the development and maintenance of data pipelines and workflows
Discuss with business units (clients) to understand their needs and create dashboards tailored to their expectations
Contribute to the documentation of processes, methodologies, and best practices
Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and project planning activities




Want to know more about us?

We are serving the Swiss market as Switzerland’s leading IT & Telecom company. Thus, we are actively driving digitalization and networking, and tapping new paths for our customers and our employees. We do not know what the future is going to look like, but we definitely have the opportunity to shape it. To do so we are and act trustworthy, committed and curious.

Since 2019, we have been building up the coolest DevOps Center with a wonderful office at the World Trade Center in the heart of Rotterdam. We are currently recruiting IT passionate professionals who are keen on developing high-quality software, have an agile mindset and appreciate collaboration with motivated colleagues from all over the world.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Dedichiamo tempo e cura alla valorizzazione del tuo talento, investiamo nelle tue competenze e diamo spazio alla tua voglia di metterti alla prova e fare la differenza. Se vuoi crescere insieme a ONIT verso l'obiettivo di essere il miglior partner nell'innovazione digitale, entra a far parte del nostro team!

La certificazione Great Place to Work conferma il nostro impegno per un ambiente lavorativo in cui il benessere e lo sviluppo delle persone sono la priorità, tanto quanto la soddisfazione dei clienti.




Profilo ricercato:




Ricerchiamo una figura di Data Analyst qualificata e proattiva. La persona ideale ha 1-2 anni di esperienza e ha conseguito la Laurea in Informatica o discipline STEM.

Si occuperà di analisi dei requisiti, progettazione e realizzazione di ambienti interattivi per l'analisi dati e creazione di strati semantici per facilitare l’accesso ai dati, anche da parte di utenti non tecnici. Sarà coinvolta in studi di fattibilità, confronto di soluzioni e stima dei benefici, garantendo la copertura funzionale.

Dovrà inoltre produrre documentazione, manuali utente e formare il personale, anche con training on the job. Infine, parteciperà alla sperimentazione di nuovi prodotti, sviluppo di prototipi e valutazione delle nuove tecnologie attraverso analisi costi/benefici.




Skills tecniche:

Modellazione dati di tipo normalizzato per basi dati operazionali e modelli dati per il data warehouse, metodologia e modelli OLAP e ROLAP, tecniche di analisi multidimensionale, linguaggio SQL
Conoscenza di tematiche applicative, best practice e metodologie di analisi, disegno e test in ambito data warehouse, business intelligence e analytics
Conoscenza della piattaforma Qlik Sense per l’analisi e l'elaborazione dei dati, la produzione di reportistica, la realizzazione di strati semantici per l'accesso ai dati da parte di utenti non specialisti
Conoscenza della piattaforma MS Power BI per l’analisi e l'elaborazione dei dati, la produzione di reportistica, la realizzazione di strati semantici per l'accesso ai dati da parte di utenti non specialisti.




Soft skills:

Capacità di lavorare in team e comunicare efficacemente
Capacità analitiche e problem-solving
Curiosità e propensione all’apprendimento costante
Precisione e orientamento all’obiettivo




Cosa offriamo:

Possibilità di smart-working
Flessibilità oraria
Ambiente di lavoro giovane, collaborativo ed innovativo
Academy interna e possibilità di crescita professionale




Essere parte di Onit vuol dire abbracciare valori come onestà, rispetto, equità, trasparenza, fiducia e responsabilità. Questi pilastri sono alla base delle nostre relazioni interne, creando un ambiente in cui ognuno può esercitare la propria attività in modo responsabile e flessibile.

Se ti riconosci nei nostri valori, candidati ora. Ti contatteremo per un primo colloquio conoscitivo o conserveremo il tuo CV per opportunità future.

Title: Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
We offer:




• Unique opportunity to get exposure to the global lending and capital markets business while working with colleagues in London

• Technical language, proprietary environment, and infrastructure training

• Technical and professional on-the job training in securitized products and structured credit

• An introduction to Morgan Stanley and the global financial markets

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Analyze assets including commercial real estate loans, residential mortgages, auto loans and other cash-flow generating assets

• Provide oversight of ongoing client requests for fundings

• Work with other internal teams to build-out transaction & collateral monitoring systems

• Provide senior management with monthly, quarterly and annual updates on the lending portfolio

• Conduct market and asset level research




You have:




• BSc or MSc in finance or a quantitative field (e.g. finance, economics and engineering)

• 0-3 years of experience. Preferably a background with a financial institution, rating agency or accounting firm

• Excellent data management skills: MS Excel, pivot tables, database management (Access or SQL experience is a plus)

• Strong work ethic, attention to detail, analytical mindset

• Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English




Team profile:




Morgan Stanley FID Deleverage and Lending group (“DLG”) is seeking to hire an analyst to be part of its lending portfolio management platform based in Budapest.

DLG provides asset-backed financing solutions to institutional clients and manages a portfolio backed by a diverse range of assets including consumer loans, residential and commercial mortgages, corporate loans, etc. The asset management team within DLG provides ongoing portfolio management, monitoring and risk oversight, and reports to senior management.




About Morgan Stanley




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Operations and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the city center.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.

To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...

Job Details

Data Analyst

Join our Unified Marketing Measurement team as a Data Analyst!

In this role, you will use innovative data analytics and data science technology, evolve your skills, and provide our clients with the best-in-class analytical solutions.

We are seeking candidates with experience in a data-related role, open to develop in some programming (SQL) and data modelling techniques.

What You’ll Do…


Data Analysis and Processing: process and validate data sets provided by clients (sales, marketing, price, promotional activities and external / macroeconomic factors).
Analytics and Machine Learning: run marketing mix models with usage of Kantar internal modelling platform to discover patterns and rules determining clients’ sales success and identify weaknesses and bugs in models for resolution.
Internal Collaboration: communicate results of data analysis / modelling to Kantar CS teams, implement feedback from CS teams to improve quality of input data / modelling results.
External Communication: communicate technical information with both technical and non-technical team members and collaborators (also clients).


What You’ll Bring…


Strong numerical skills and exceptional attention to detail required to analyse/transform complex data sets and combine data from different sources.
Some experience with data-related technologies, including database queries, data analysis and eagerness to develop new skills.
Experience in Excel.
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on logical thinking and critical analysis.
Previous experience with MMM solutions (tools / methods) is welcome but not required.


WHY JOIN KANTAR?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Kantar Rewards Statement

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration.

We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

Location

Warsaw, Plac KoneseraPoland

Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.
