Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Como Business Data Analyst (SQL + PowerBI) te integrarás dentro del equipo Digital Data en el área de Ecommerce de Massimo Dutti.




Buscamos personas proactivas, con capacidad para trabajar en equipo y excelentes habilidades técnicas, así como una fuerte orientación a resultados y comprensión estratégica del negocio.




Tus responsabilidades:

Junto con el departamento, definición y cálculo de KPIs avanzados que permitan evaluar el buen performance de las diferentes áreas de negocio.
Extracción, procesamiento y organización de datos. (SQL, Phyton, Snowflake, Big Query).
Conceptualización, diseño y construcción de cuadros de mando en Power BI, destinados a las demás áreas de negocio que consuman la información.
Participar en la elaboración de informes estratégicos.
Interpretación y lectura de los informes siendo capaz de construir insights relevantes a partir de la información contenida en los datos y transmitirla de forma eficiente a las diferentes áreas del negocio.
Trabajar con el resto del equipo de datos (Business Analysts, Data Engineers y Data Scientists) para implementar las soluciones propuestas.




Formación

Formación superior en Ingeniería, ADE, Matemáticas, Estadística o similar.
Valorable Máster en Data Analytics o Data Science.




Experiencia Laboral

Experiencia de al menos 5 años como Data Analyst en entornos digitales, preferiblemente Ecommerce.
Amplia experiencia con bases de datos, SQL y Python.
Habilidad para entender y crear soluciones técnicas utilizando diferentes tecnologías.
Habilidades solidas en visualización de datos en Power BI.
Valorable experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos predictivos y machine learning.




Skills Tecnológicas

Nivel expert en SQL y Phyton.
Nivel avanzado de PowerBi y Excel.
Muy valorable experiencia en Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Big Query, Snowflake y familiarización con productos de la suite de Google.




Skills comunicativas y personales

Habilidades comunicativas tanto en Español como en Inglés.
Fuerte visión de negocio y de cómo el dato puede ser el motor del cambio en las decisiones estratégicas de la compañía.
Habilidad para trabajar de forma autónoma como integrante de un equipo.
Mentalidad orientada a resultados y a resolución de problemas complejos.
Atención al detalle, garantizando precisión e integridad en todos los análisis.
Capacidad de traducir del lenguaje de negocio al técnico y viceversa.
Interés por el mundo de la moda.




Qué te ofrecemos

Dispondrás de un servicio de comedor subvencionado.
Disfrutarás de un gimnasio en nuestras instalaciones, además de clases dirigidas.
Servicio de autobús-empresa subvencionado con salida desde diferentes puntos de Barcelona, Mataró, Vallés.
InLife, un club para acercarte productos y servicios a nuestras oficinas (farmacia, mensajería etc.).
Siendo parte del grupo Inditex podrás comprar en cualquiera de nuestras marcas, con un 25% de descuento.




Massimo Dutti es una empresa comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades.

Show more
HTML:
Como Business Data Analyst (SQL + PowerBI) te integrarás dentro del equipo Digital Data en el área de Ecommerce de Massimo Dutti.


Buscamos personas proactivas, con capacidad para trabajar en equipo y excelentes habilidades técnicas, así como una fuerte orientación a resultados y comprensión estratégica del negocio.


Tus responsabilidades:

  • Junto con el departamento, definición y cálculo de KPIs avanzados que permitan evaluar el buen performance de las diferentes áreas de negocio.
  • Extracción, procesamiento y organización de datos. (SQL, Phyton, Snowflake, Big Query).
  • Conceptualización, diseño y construcción de cuadros de mando en Power BI, destinados a las demás áreas de negocio que consuman la información.
  • Participar en la elaboración de informes estratégicos.
  • Interpretación y lectura de los informes siendo capaz de construir insights relevantes a partir de la información contenida en los datos y transmitirla de forma eficiente a las diferentes áreas del negocio.
  • Trabajar con el resto del equipo de datos (Business Analysts, Data Engineers y Data Scientists) para implementar las soluciones propuestas.


Formación

  • Formación superior en Ingeniería, ADE, Matemáticas, Estadística o similar.
  • Valorable Máster en Data Analytics o Data Science.


Experiencia Laboral

  • Experiencia de al menos 5 años como Data Analyst en entornos digitales, preferiblemente Ecommerce.
  • Amplia experiencia con bases de datos, SQL y Python.
  • Habilidad para entender y crear soluciones técnicas utilizando diferentes tecnologías.
  • Habilidades solidas en visualización de datos en Power BI.
  • Valorable experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos predictivos y machine learning.


Skills Tecnológicas

  • Nivel expert en SQL y Phyton.
  • Nivel avanzado de PowerBi y Excel.
  • Muy valorable experiencia en Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Big Query, Snowflake y familiarización con productos de la suite de Google.


Skills comunicativas y personales

  • Habilidades comunicativas tanto en Español como en Inglés.
  • Fuerte visión de negocio y de cómo el dato puede ser el motor del cambio en las decisiones estratégicas de la compañía.
  • Habilidad para trabajar de forma autónoma como integrante de un equipo.
  • Mentalidad orientada a resultados y a resolución de problemas complejos.
  • Atención al detalle, garantizando precisión e integridad en todos los análisis.
  • Capacidad de traducir del lenguaje de negocio al técnico y viceversa.
  • Interés por el mundo de la moda.


Qué te ofrecemos

  • Dispondrás de un servicio de comedor subvencionado.
  • Disfrutarás de un gimnasio en nuestras instalaciones, además de clases dirigidas.
  • Servicio de autobús-empresa subvencionado con salida desde diferentes puntos de Barcelona, Mataró, Vallés.
  • InLife, un club para acercarte productos y servicios a nuestras oficinas (farmacia, mensajería etc.).
  • Siendo parte del grupo Inditex podrás comprar en cualquiera de nuestras marcas, con un 25% de descuento.


Massimo Dutti es una empresa comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities




Supporting onboarding activities for our customers, case management and case handling
Resolving customer data related cases (checking data, correcting data, validating data, preparing reports, importing data etc.)
Aligning internally on customer questions with the other team and company colleagues
Generating reports from SQL databases and creating queries
Preparing dashboards for customers and for internal purposes
Working with data maintenance, including importing, extracting, correcting and validating data
Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling




Requirements




Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
Excellent Excel skills
Advanced SQL skills
Good Power Query skills
Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
Strong spoken and written English

Show more
HTML:
Responsibilities


  • Supporting onboarding activities for our customers, case management and case handling
  • Resolving customer data related cases (checking data, correcting data, validating data, preparing reports, importing data etc.)
  • Aligning internally on customer questions with the other team and company colleagues
  • Generating reports from SQL databases and creating queries
  • Preparing dashboards for customers and for internal purposes
  • Working with data maintenance, including importing, extracting, correcting and validating data
  • Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
  • In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling


Requirements


  • Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
  • Excellent Excel skills
  • Advanced SQL skills
  • Good Power Query skills
  • Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
  • Strong spoken and written English

Title: Data Analyst | Lisboa
Description:
A Decskill nasceu em 2014 como uma Empresa de Consultoria em Tecnologia da Informação e com a premissa que o seu maior ativo são as suas pessoas. Com o propósito de criar valor através do conhecimento e do talento, a Decskill promove uma cultura de excelência e investe no desenvolvimento e bem-estar dos colaboradores. Com mais de 600 profissionais dedicados e escritórios em Lisboa, Porto, Madrid e Luxemburgo, a Decskill atua hoje em três áreas de negócio:




• Decskill Talent: Acreditamos que as nossas pessoas são fundamentais para o nosso sucesso de todos. Através da Decskill Talent, capacitamos e acompanhamos equipas em desafios da transformação digital dos nossos clientes. Colaboramos com os clientes na sua estratégia de transição digital e inovação, garantindo o sucesso do projeto e o crescimento do negócio.




• Decskill Boost: O nosso compromisso com o talento estende-se a novos modelos de desenvolvimento e colaboração. Dotando a nossa equipa com as mais recentes ferramentas, metodologias e melhores práticas, otimizamos o Time-to-Market e entregamos soluções inovadoras que superam expectativas do cliente.




• Decskill Connect: Na Decskill Connect, a equipa Decskill colabora de perto com os clientes para implementar e gerir infraestruturas de tecnologia da informação que geram valor a longo prazo.




O sucesso da Decskill é construído pelo foco nas nossas pessoas e pela capacidade de enfrentar os desafios da transformação digital com agilidade e flexibilidade. Criamos valor não só para os nossos clientes, mas também para todo o nosso ecossistema onde fomentamos uma comunidade digital dedicada ao crescimento dos negócios através da tecnologia.




Procuramos um Data Analyst para um projeto híbrido em Lisboa.




Responsabilidades:

Criar reports e relatórios técnicos e funcionais;
Capacidade de sintetizar informações e efetuar a transformação, consolidação e simplificação de fontes de dados.




Requisitos:

Experiência prévia na função;
Experiência com SQL para extração de dados do Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL ou MongoDB;
Conhecimentos de Git/ GitHub Actions (valorizado);
É valorizado o conhecimento de espanhol ou inglês.




Se a oportunidade corresponde às suas expectativas envie-nos o seu CV para o email catia.carvalho@decskill.com, com a referência “CC/DA”.




A Decskill assume um compromisso de igualdade e não discriminação com todos os seus talentos. Recrutamos e promovemos talento, com base na diversidade e inclusão, independentemente da idade, género, etnia, raça, nacionalidade ou qualquer outra forma de discriminação incompatível com a dignidade da pessoa humana.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
En Keepler queremos hacer crecer nuestro equipo con personas que tengan ganas de desarrollar software basado en datos con dos objetivos: ayudar en la transformación a nuestros clientes y disfrutar del proceso de crear valor a través de la tecnología.




Si quieres ser parte de un equipo que te ofrecerá retos tecnológicos y que te exigirá una mejora y aprendizaje continuo, si no tienes miedo a reconocer errores y eres capaz de ser proactivo/a y tirar del carro cuando te toque, es posible que Keepler sea el sitio donde deberías trabajar. ¿Te interesa? Echa un vistazo a nuestra vacante de Data Analyst.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Experiencia como Data Analyst con un perfil analítico muy marcado.
Alto conocimiento y experiencia en lenguaje SQL y con conocimiento en modelo de datos relacionales.
Experiencia en herramientas de reporting, como Power BI.
Capacidad para trabajar con negocio y para entender procesos complejos asociados con datos.
Buena capacidad de trabajo en equipo.




Deseable:




Conocimiento de las herramientas complementarias a PowerBI (DAX Studio, Tabular Editor)
Conocimientos sobre el diseño y optimización de bases de datos analíticas.
Conocimiento de servicios AWS (Athena, S3...)
Experiencia con metodologías Agile.
Inglés B2-C1.




¿Qué te ofrecemos en Keepler?




Un buen ambiente de trabajo junto a compañeros/as que son unos/as cracks en sus tecnologías y de quienes aprenderás cada día.
Tendrás un presupuesto personal anual de 2.000 euros para que lo dediques a formación y certificaciones.
Teletrabajo con asistencia flexible a la oficina o trabajo remoto desde cualquier lugar de España. Nuestra oficina está situada en el centro de Madrid, lo que permite disfrutar de la ciudad en un entorno inmejorable y bien comunicado.
Ayuda económica mensual para consumibles del hogar derivados del teletrabajo.
Horario flexible de entrada y salida y flexibilidad en el almuerzo, para que tu vida personal y profesional encajen sin problema.
Jornada intensiva los viernes todo el año y los meses de julio y agosto.
Ayuda alimentaria de 11 euros al día que podrás recibir en ticket restaurante o en nómina, a tu elección.
Retribución flexible para tarjeta transporte, cheque guardería y seguro médico para familiares.
Formación inglés one-to-one gratis para ti, con 8 sesiones al mes en modalidad online y que puedes utilizar de lunes a domingo, para que lo adaptes a tu tiempo.
Seguro médico privado con una amplia cobertura nacional e internacional, además de seguro dental y ventajas y precio reducido para tus familiares.
Tu seguro médico incluye 20 sesiones de asistencia psicológica presencial al año y sesiones ilimitadas vía telefónica.
Salario competitivo basado en la meritocracia que reflejará tu crecimiento profesional y podrás hacerlo crecer añadiendo skills a tu perfil. ¿Qué significa? Te lo explicamos en este artículo: http://bit.ly/2rlIVUQ
Tu evaluación y subida salarial la realizarán tus compañeros/as, nada de jefes porque aquí no encontrarás ninguno/a, y tienes 2 oportunidades al año para presentarte a una subida.
Una compañía con una cultura muy colaborativa que siempre piensa en hacerte la vida profesional más fácil para que solo te preocupes en hacer bien lo que te gusta.
Tendrás acompañamiento de un buddy los primeros meses para que te ayude en la adaptación.
Un ambiente solidario y transparente donde tus decisiones afectan a todos en la que prima la solidaridad contigo y con quien está a tu lado.




Así entendemos Keepler, ¿te animas a trabajar con nosotros/as?




We believe

en el talento apasionado por la tecnología.




We want

personas con diferentes cualidades, mentes inquietas y deseo de aprender, explorar e implementar nuevas tecnologías que aporten valor a cada proyecto.




We invest

en el desarrollo continuo de nuestros profesionales.




We foster

una cultura de equipo y generosidad.




Salario:

El salario que te ofrecemos responde a una fórmula que tiene en cuenta tu perfil y ciertos skills claves para la compañía. Para estos perfiles, el rango salarial depende de tu experiencia y es 39k-46k euros al año con la posibilidad de complementarlo con skills hasta 10k euros al año. Los skills valorados son: experiencia en Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Engineer eXtreme Programming, Kanban y Machine Learning.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: 3 years

Location : Hybrid - Lisbon




Skills Needed?







Bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject,
3+ years of experience as data Analyst;
Expertise with Power BI, Tableau, Dataiku, PostgreSQL and ETL tools;
Fluency in English;
The candidate has to be in Lisbon - hybrid position.




Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.




Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us. We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together.

Title: Clinical Data Analyst
Description:
Clinical Data Analyst

I am working directly with a global pharmaceutical company who is the leader in diabetics care and are looking for a Clinical Data Analyst to join their team.

Job details

Location: Brussels, Belgium (4 days onsite 1 day remote)

Start date: October

Duration: 3 month initial contract (12 month project)

Ideal candidate

- Experience with UAT (user acceptance testing) & FT (functional testing)

- Some exposure supporting troubleshooting

- Experience with Oracle clinical software

- Experience using software development and code storage systems

If you have the necessary experience or know someone who may be good for this opportunity, please do send over yours, or theres, contact details and we can discuss in more detail.

- Experience using software development and code storage systems

If you have the necessary experience or know someone who may be good for this opportunity, please do send over yours, or theres, contact details and we can discuss in more detail.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Somos a Glintt Global, uma empresa de matriz portuguesa, líder em tecnologia, com mais de 30 anos de experiência. Pretendemos impactar a qualidade de vida das pessoas através da inovação, tecnologia, do conhecimento e da ambição que nos acompanham. Este é o nosso compromisso!

Para tal, precisamos de ti! Procuramos um Data Analyst para integrar a equipa de Glintt Life- Hospitals- Services, nos nossos escritórios do Porto. Na nossa empresa, terás a oportunidade de aliar todos os teus interesses e competências para nos ajudar a tornar o mundo um pouco mais Glintter!

Como será o teu dia a dia na Glintt?

  • Acompanhamento do cliente;
  • Tradução das necessidades analíticas dos clientes;
  • Análise de requisitos;
  • Modelação e preparação da informação para o perfil do projeto;



O que achamos que precisas de ter?

  • Conhecimentos e experiência em análise funcional;
  • Conhecimentos técnicos em metodologias de levantamento de requisitos, em particular para Data Products;
  • Conhecimentos e experiência no desenvolvimento de Dashboards, Reports, Workflows, UseCases, Data Flows e Process Flows;
  • Conhecimento e experiência em plataformas de BI (PowerBi, Tableau, Metabase, Looker);
  • Conhecimento e experiência de SQL e Python;
  • Conhecimentos e interesse na área da saúde.
  • Conhecimentos e experiência de sistemas de informação da área hospitalar.
  • Visão analítica e rigor;
  • Autonomia, iniciativa e proatividade;
  • Orientação para os resultados;
  • Team Worker.



O que vais encontrar na Glintt?

  • Ambiente de trabalho incrível;
  • Investimento nas tuas competências;
  • Respeito pela tua individualidade;
  • Autonomia e reconhecimento pelo teu sucesso;
  • Instalações preparadas ao detalhe para que te sintas em casa.



Qual o nosso plano para ti?

  • Mentoria;
  • Plano de carreira adaptado às tuas capacidades;
  • Plano de formação individual em soft e hard skills;
  • Participação em projetos desafiantes;
  • Possibilidade de fazer a diferença na vida das pessoas.



Caso ainda não tenhas ficado convencido/a, oferecemos ainda:

  • Workshops e promoção de um estilo de vida saudável
  • Salário fixo e variável
  • Seguro de saúde
  • E muito mais...



E muito mais…

Ficaste entusiasmado/a? Consideras-te a pessoa ideal para esta função? De que estás à espera? Não percas mais tempo e candidata-te a vir ser feliz nesta aventura!

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¿Qué estamos buscando? Buscamos un Técnico en Análisis de Datos para Retail - Sector Textil Hogar




Descripción de la empresa:

En Tramas trabajamos para mejorar la calidad de vida en el hogar y el bienestar de las personas, vistiendo con funcionalidad, diversidad y alegría todos los espacios y habitantes de la casa, con productos textiles elaborados a partir de algodón y nuevos materiales a precios accesibles. Tenemos casi 200 tiendas y somos 800 profesionales los que conformamos la compañía.




Nos enfocamos en la calidad y diseño de nuestros productos y la satisfacción de nuestros clientes. Estamos buscando incorporar a un Técnico en Análisis de Datos para optimizar nuestras operaciones de Retail.




Responsabilidades del puesto:

Análisis de datos de ventas y clientes: Interpretar los datos provenientes de diferentes puntos de venta (tiendas físicas y online).
Elaboración de reportes y dashboards: Crear informes periódicos para diferentes equipos (comercial, marketing, stock) utilizando herramientas como Excel, Power BI, Tableau o similares.
Análisis de tendencias de mercado: Identificar patrones en el comportamiento de los consumidores y tendencias en el sector textil hogar.
Optimización del stock y surtido en tienda: Realizar estudios para mejorar la gestión de inventarios, proyecciones de demanda y planificación de surtido en tienda.
Colaboración con otros departamentos: Trabajar estrechamente con equipos de marketing, compras y ventas para proporcionar análisis estratégicos.
Propuestas de mejora: Identificar oportunidades de mejora en las estrategias de pricing, promociones y campañas basadas en los datos.




Requisitos:

Formación académica: Licenciatura en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, Economía o carreras afines.
Experiencia previa: Mínimo 2-3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos, idealmente en el sector retail o relacionado.
Conocimiento de herramientas de análisis de datos: Dominio de Excel, bases de datos (SQL), y herramientas de visualización como Power BI, Tableau o similares.
Conocimientos en modelos predictivos: Experiencia en análisis de tendencias y modelos predictivos es un plus.
Habilidades analíticas: Capacidad para interpretar grandes volúmenes de datos y proponer recomendaciones basadas en el análisis.
Actitud proactiva y orientación a resultados: Se valorará la capacidad para trabajar de manera independiente y proponer soluciones creativas.




Competencias valoradas:

Capacidad de comunicación: Habilidad para presentar los resultados del análisis de manera clara a diferentes públicos.
Organización y planificación: Buena gestión del tiempo y capacidad para trabajar en múltiples proyectos simultáneamente.
Adaptabilidad y flexibilidad: Capacidad para ajustarse a un entorno dinámico y con cambios frecuentes.




Ofrecemos:

Ambiente de trabajo dinámico en una empresa en constante crecimiento.
Oportunidades de desarrollo y formación continua.
Contrato indefinido con jornada intensiva de mañana durante todo el año.




Formaciones académicas recomendadas:

Grado en Estadística o Matemáticas:
Grado en Ingeniería Industrial o Ingeniería Informática:
Grado en Economía, Administración y Dirección de Empresas (ADE), o Finanzas:
Grado en Ciencia de Datos o Análisis de Negocios:
Formación complementaria o másteres especializados:
Máster en Big Data, Business Analytics o Ciencia de Datos.
Posgrados en análisis de datos o inteligencia de negocios.
Certificaciones en herramientas específicas como Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Python o R, que son muy útiles para el procesamiento de datos y la creación de dashboards visuales.




Competencias Técnicas Adicionales a valorar:

Análisis de datos y herramientas de visualización: Excel avanzado, Power BI, Tableau, Google Data Studio.
Bases de datos: SQL para extracción y manejo de datos.
Lenguajes de programación: Python o R, útiles para el análisis estadístico o creación de modelos predictivos.
Experiencia laboral previa en empresas de Retail, tanto en puestos de oficina, como en puestos de tienda.




Condiciones de Contratación:

Tipo de industria de la oferta: Venta al por menor
Departamento: Retail
Nivel: Empleado/a
Horario: 7:00 a 15:15
Salario: Salario: 20.000€ - 28.000€ Bruto/año en función de experiencia demostrable




Ofrecemos:

Jornada intensiva de mañana todo el año
Buen ambiente laboral. Equipo joven, ambiente distendido. Nos gusta juntarnos para celebrar y compartir ocasiones especiales.
Apostamos por la formación continua, dando la oportunidad a nuestros trabajadores de continuar formándose en materias relacionadas con su puesto de trabajo.
Proyecto a largo plazo en plena fase de expansión. Estamos creciendo y queremos construir Equipos de trabajo estable que contribuyan a llevar al negocio a otro nivel. Apostamos por las nuevas tecnologías, en Análisis de Datos y la IA.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🤩 Build with us

Understanding our users and their behavior allows us to offer the best possible gaming experience, and happy users = happy company. So how do we best understand our

users? By understanding our data!

We’re looking for a Data Analyst who will work in a product team to investigate, understand, and present insights on our data. This figure must be proactive in preempting business needs, with the goal of using data to help the company make better decisions.

This role should combine good business understanding with solid technical/analytics skills, and thus the figure must be able to relate well with product and management.




📖 Your quests will be:

Creating a streamlined and impactful reporting/dashboard structure (our BI tool of choice is Hex)
Defining and assessing the impact & significance of metrics (what to look at, how to look at it, and why it may have changed)
Designing and evaluating experiments (A/B testing)
Guiding the product team in the creation and modification of features based on analyses and trends




🎮 To start playing, you will need:

SQL (and relational databases)
Basic Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib) or R
Data Visualization tools (Tableau, Domo, Looker, Grafana, etc.)
Fluent English




👤 The type of player you are:

Strives to identify and solve problems
Highly analytical
Good communication skills
Desire for self-improvement




👑 Our company values:

Use critical thinking: don't assume, validate your gut feeling!
Take ownership and make it happen!
Love what you do and have fun doing it!
Work on the problem, not just the symptoms!
Don't overcomplicate it, keep it simple and effective!
Share ideas to reduce bias and improve results!







🌈 Power-ups to have more fun

🏡 Smart Working policy

🥳 An innovative, dynamic, and friendly work environment in which you will have the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, thanks to our amazing team

🏢 Amazing HQ office in the centre of Milan (M2 – Stazione Garibaldi)

🇬🇧 English courses provided by a native teacher (related to your English level)

🎤 Monthly Product/Design/Marketing/Tech panels to be aligned with all departments’ results

💻 Amazing workstation with the latest MacBook Pro and a Display Screen (Whatever makes you work better is welcome!)

📄 A top-notch contract proposal

🍽️ Ticket restaurant when working from the office

🍕 Free Coffee & Beer; once a month pizza lunch together

🕙 Flexible work hours

🏄 Internal Team Building events

🛋️ Relax Area with Sofà, Foosball Table, and Board Games




Don't live in Milan? Check out our work model




Building community and having a place to connect with each other is very important for us. We like not only to work together, but to have time to get to know each other, to celebrate and have fun. We also value people's choice to work from anywhere, that's why we have a very flexible hybrid model.




Our policy is 4 days per month at the office, and we decide however we're gonna go. There are people who like to go once every week, or two days every two weeks, four days straight, or even combining the last 4 days of one month with the first 4 days of the next month and only go 8 days straight every two months. Whatever works best for you!




If you don’t live in Italy, we have two options: if you would like to relocate, our company offers a relocation package to help you move to Milan; if you want to stay where you are, we offer a benefit to help you with travel expenses and flexible working hours around your journey time.

Title: DATA Specialist | 32-40 uur per week, Amersfoort
Description:
Ben jij onze nieuwe Medior Data Specialist met Development skills? Voor onze snelst groeiende servicelijn IT-audit & services zijn wij op zoek naar een gedreven en enthousiaste collega met een gezonde dosis humor.

De Vacature In Het Kort


Salaris: Marktconform
Opleiding: HBO werk en denkniveau
Werkervaring: 3+ jaar
De mogelijkheid om door te groeien tot Senior Data specialist.


Klinkt dit als iets voor jou? Lees dan verder.

Wat ga je doen ?

In de rol van Medior Data Specialist ben jij dé collega met kennis op gebied van Data Analytics en heb je affiniteit met development. In deze rol bij CROP ben je verantwoordelijk voor het uitvoeren van data-analytics en development werkzaamheden. Je werkt nauw samen met onze cliënten om inzichten te verkrijgen, dashboards te bouwen, applicaties te ontwikkelen en data te modelleren. Bovendien speel je een cruciale rol in het identificeren van adviesbehoeften en draag je bij aan het coachen van junior teamleden.

Heb jij een passie voor data-analytics en affiniteit met development? Ben je klaar om de volgende stap in je carrière te zetten en je kennis in beide gebieden verder te ontwikkelen? Bij ons krijg je de kans om te schitteren en je vaardigheden naar een hoger niveau te tillen.

Bij ons draait alles om innovatie, samenwerking en ontwikkeling. We zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde Data Specialist die deel wil uitmaken van ons dynamische team. Bij ons staan kennisdeling, persoonlijke ontwikkeling en teamwork centraal. We bieden een inspirerende werkomgeving waar je de vrijheid hebt om deel te nemen aan opwindende projecten en je eigen pad te bewandelen.

Wat bieden we jou? 


Een goed salaris voor jouw toegevoegde waarde. 
Goede werk-privé balans door onze tijd-voor-tijd regeling, flexibele werktijden, parttime mogelijkheden en 29 vakantiedagen. 
Thuiswerkregeling inclusief thuiswerkvoorzieningen. 
Focus op vakinhoudelijke en persoonlijke ontwikkeling door een goede onboarding, training on the job, een ruime studieregeling, de jaarlijkse CROParade en onze CROP Academy. 
Laptop en smartphone. 
Leaseauto, mobiliteitsregeling.
Fiscaal voordelige fietsleaseregeling. 
Premievrij basispensioen. 
Aandacht voor rustmomenten tijdens het werk met stoelmassage en diverse activiteiten op de kantoren.


Wie ben jij? 

Onze ideale nieuwe CROP collega: 


Heeft minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Data Specialist en affiniteit met ontwikkelingswerkzaamheden.
Heeft kennis van het optimaliseren van data processen en rapportages.
Heeft affiniteit met financiële data.
Kan bijdragen aan de visie op datagedreven werken binnen de organisatie.
Is klantgericht, communicatief sterk en analytisch. 
Toont zelfstartendheid en een ondernemende geest. 
Heeft een pro-actieve werkhouding en denkt in mogelijkheden en oplossingen. 
Beschikt over een afgeronde HBO- of WO- opleiding,  bijvoorbeeld Business & IT.
Heeft sterke affiniteit met data en kennis van Power BI.
Kennis van Azure Synapse en Python is een pré.


Schroom niet om contact op te nemen, ook wanneer je niet aan alle bovenstaande wensen voldoet. We kijken graag naar de mogelijkheden. 

Solliciteren of meer informatie? 

Ben je enthousiast geworden, dan komen we graag met je in gesprek! Neem telefonisch of via whatsapp contact op met onze recruiters Jetske Hoyng-Ruiter of Iris Luteijn . We leggen met veel plezier uit wie we zijn, hoe we werken en wat we voor jou kunnen betekenen. Jouw wensen vinden we belangrijk.

  • Heeft sterke affiniteit met data en kennis van Power BI.
  • Kennis van Azure Synapse en Python is een pré.

Schroom niet om contact op te nemen, ook wanneer je niet aan alle bovenstaande wensen voldoet. We kijken graag naar de mogelijkheden. 

Solliciteren of meer informatie? 

Ben je enthousiast geworden, dan komen we graag met je in gesprek! Neem telefonisch of via whatsapp contact op met onze recruiters Jetske Hoyng-Ruiter of Iris Luteijn . We leggen met veel plezier uit wie we zijn, hoe we werken en wat we voor jou kunnen betekenen. Jouw wensen vinden we belangrijk.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Location: Waterford, Ireland
Duration: 8 months


Closing date for applications: 23rd September 2024

Start date for the internship: January/February 2025

Please note this is a paid internship

About The Job

Looking to launch your career at the cutting edge of healthcare? Join Sanofi for a chance to develop with mentoring and guidance from inspirational leaders while helping to make an impact on the lives of countless people worldwide. As Data Analyst Intern, you’ll spend your time gaining valuable skills and experience. It’s a fantastic opportunity to see next-generation technology up close while working alongside some of the best in the industry.

About Waterford

For more than 20 years, our Waterford team has continued to grow and diversify to serve patients around the world. Today, a team of almost 800 work together at a state-of-the-art biopharmaceutical and medical device campus. Recognised through multiple local and national awards, Sanofi Waterford offers flexible working and access to a world of opportunities to grow your career at one location. As well as attractive benefits, the team enjoy access to an onsite gym and medical centre that underpin a strong commitment to health and wellbeing.

Main responsibilities:


Support our site Data Analytics function's on-going performance improvement initiatives.
Comply with all Sanofi documentation and participate in policy, procedure and standards development.
Conduct simple/complex data visualization, data analysis and data science work to support the site teams in understanding their data to support decision making.
Create and report Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) with strong communications skills in an understandable way for stakeholders. Drive a "speaking with data" culture.
Contribute to identifying new and future opportunities for Data Analysis or Data Science.
Engage with central Sanofi Data Science team(off site) to scope and initiate opportunities for the site or the wider Sanofi network of sites.
Gain experience in Sanofi data environments, platforms and systems.


About You


Education: 2nd or 3rd year student working towards a degree in Data Analytics, Data Science disciplines or related.
Soft and technical skills:

Proficiency in common IT Applications (Microsoft Office, Microsoft Teams, etc.).
Experience of data Visualization tools such as Power BI, Qlik Sense or similar.
Previous exposure to SQL, python or other similar programming disciplines.
Strong communication skills with an ability to work well in teams.
Strong execution and delivery mindset.
Strong attention to detail with the determination to solve problems.
Ability to prioritize tasks and efficiently manage time.


Why choose us?


Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team.
Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career.
Our Waterford site is easily accessible from the M9 and offers excellent facilities including a subsidized restaurant and newly refurbished gym.


Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let’s pursue progress. And let’s discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

Pursue progress, discover extraordinary

Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, ability or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are considering applicants in – Leeds / Dublin

Style of work – Hybrid 2 days per week

This role is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about data analytics to pioneer the discipline in a rapidly growing area of the business. Critical thinking and problem solving will be key for exploring the challenges & opportunities as we develop the team. You will work within our Global Trading Team, in Flutter Group, to help us deliver against our ambitious Sportsbook vision which is shared across 10+ brands in Flutter.

Your mission will be to uncover key insights from Flutter’s global data, enabling quality decision-making about the future of our platforms and risk products.

You will leverage your strong SQL skills and data storytelling abilities to extract valuable insights from our vast data sources and communicate these insights to various stakeholders, to inspire action and change. Your role will involve transforming complex data into compelling narratives and supporting data-driven decision-making across our product lines.

Who are we?

Flutter Entertainment is the world’s leading online sports betting and gaming company with a market capitlisation of c. $37bn operating some of the most innovative, diverse and distinctive brands in the sector.

A constituent of both the London FTSE 100 and New York Stock Exchange , Flutter brings entertainment to life for over 20 million customers in a safe, responsible and sustainable way.

We call this the Flutter Edge – the combined power of our talented people, market-leading products, smart technology and the financial capital to succeed.

Operating in 20+ regulated markets , through our Positive Impact Plan , we are committed to making a positive contribution for our customers, colleagues, communities and the planet that we play on.

The Group uses a divisional management and operating structure across its companies: each division has an empowered management team, which is responsible for maintaining momentum and growth in its respective markets.

On 14th May 2024, it was announced that Flutter would be moving its primary listing from the UK to the US, and its global operational headquarters from Dublin to New York (effective 31st May 2024).

Responsibilities


Data Analysis: Utilize your SQL skills to explore, analyse, and interpret large datasets related to sports betting, customer behaviour, and platform performance.
Collaboration: Build great relationships across teams, including Trading Leads, Product Managers, Product Owners, Delivery Leads, and Engineering Managers, to understand their data requirements and provide valuable insights in the Product Discovery phase or OKR progression tracking
Data Storytelling: Craft data-driven visualisations and narratives which provide clear and actionable insights for our teams, making complex data accessible and understandable to all.
Continuous Learning: Be enthusiastic about expanding your skillset, including learning new data platforms & tools, programming languages and techniques to enhance your data analysis capabilities.
Experimentation: Foster a culture of experimentation across teams, leading the design, execution, and analysis of experiments to optimize our product line.
Data Transformation and Quality: Together with the Data Engineers, transform multiple raw data sources into clean views and continuously maintain data integrity, identifying and rectifying issues as they arise.


What experience and skills would we usually look for?


Commercial experience as a data analyst, ideally in product analytics.
Experience using SQL to query large relational databases.
An ability to work independently and provide a personal resolution to projects.
A track record of excellence in subjects with a mathematical or statistical focus.
Advanced use of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
Knowledge of statistical programming software and techniques (e.g. Python, R, etc.).
Experience of extracting, analysing, and interpreting large and sometimes incomplete data sets.
Advanced communication skills including experience of delivering output that is clear and succinct despite the subject being complex to senior stakeholders.
Curious and questioning approach with a high attention to detail.
Willingness to learn and continuously improve.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Interest in the sports betting industry is a distinct advantage.
Other desirable skills: Tableau, Looker, Power BI


Benefits


Uncapped Holiday Allowance (you read that right!)
Enhanced Pension Scheme (please ask for your location and we will share)
Bonus Scheme
Life Assurance
Income protection
Private healthcare (with option to add dependent)
£/₤1,000 annual self-development learning fund & Access to thousands of Udemy courses
Invest via the Company Share save Scheme, Discount vouchers, Volunteering days.
‘Take 20’ work from another location for up to 20 days
Enhanced Parental Leave and paid time off for appointments.
Reward portal eg. electric car scheme, gym membership discounts etc.
Wellbeing scheme
On-site Gym, Canteen and Gaming area plus many more!


At Flutter we’re working to be an inclusive employer, and we encourage people from all backgrounds, ways of thinking and working to apply. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences; you don't have to meet all the requirements listed to apply for this role.

If you need any adjustments to make this role work for you let us know, and we’ll see how we can accommodate them.

Our Work Experience is the combination of everything that's unique about us: our culture, our core values, our company meetings, our commitment to sustainability, our recognition programs, but most importantly, it's our people. Our employees are self-disciplined, hardworking, curious, trustworthy, humble, and truthful. They make choices according to what is best for the team, they live for opportunities to collaborate and make a difference, and they make us one of the Top Workplaces in the area.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Desde Ona estamos buscando a un/a Junior Data Analyst para nuestro departamento de Revenue.




¡Estamos en plena expansión y crecimiento!




¿Qué nos diferencia? ¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Ona está creciendo muchísimo, es un momento muy bueno para entrar a formar parte de nosotros/as, crecer y construir juntos.
Contrato indefinido e incorporación inmediata.
Oportunidad de desarrollo y promoción interna.
Salario de incorporación: 24.000€ - 26.000 € (según experiencia)
Beneficios sociales: Retribución flexible Cobee, Adeslas a precio reducido, descuentos en nuestros complejos, RCI, descuentos en la plataforma ShoppyClub, entre otros.
Diferentes actividades a lo largo del año: Afterworks, evento de Navidad, etc...
Flexibilidad horaria, entrada entre 8:30 y 9:30; salida a partir de las 17:30. Viernes intensivos.




Serás una pieza fundamental y clave para este departamento, y para Ona.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones principales?




- Mantenimiento de bases de datos (SQL Server y Azure SQL, SSAS).

- Gestión de proyectos de diseño y despliegue de sistemas de información.

- Capacidad para traducir los datos recabados en información de valor.

- Diseño de informes que puedan ayudar al departamento de Revenue en soluciones técnicas y en la toma de decisiones.

- Experiencia en la creación de dashboards y reportes interactivos.




¿Qué necesitamos de ti?




- Estudios universitarios en campos tecnológicos y TI, o Grado Superior con experiencia en el sector.

- Experiencia comprobable en desarrollo y creación de informes.

- Conocimientos en Power BI y SQL.

- Excelente capacidad de comunicación y presentación de informes.

- Trabajo en equipo y colaboración con diferentes departamentos.

- Adaptabilidad y aprendizaje continuo para mantenerse al día con las últimas tendencias tecnológicas.




Serán altamente valorados:

-Conocimientos comprobables con herramientas del entorno Microsoft Fabric / Microsoft Power Platform.

-Certificaciones en Power BI y/o SQL.

-Transact SQL o KQL.

Title: Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
¿Eres únic@?

Entonces eres KPMG Originals. Un modo de entender la vida y tu profesión diferente desde donde marcar la diferencia. Un modo de crecer en un ambiente profesional que busca cambiar las cosas, transformar las empresas y la sociedad.

Ven, alcanza tus metas, supera tus límites en un ambiente profesional único y únete a una firma que es más que una firma de Servicios Profesionales. Sé KPMG Originals.




En KPMG K-TIA (Tecnología e Innovación en Auditoría) contamos con un equipo excepcional, una amplia gama de servicios y de recursos tecnológicos adecuados, una potente red global y una clara estrategia para llegar al mercado. Por ello, nuestro equipo de Auditoría IT se encuentra en un proceso de expansión y captación de talento.




Actualmente, nos encontramos buscando un/a especialista de analista de datos para ampliar el equipo.




¿Qué podrás hacer?

Desarrollar soluciones para la digitalización y automatización de tareas administrativas, así como la ejecución de procesamiento de datos con desarrollos propios basados en SQL y DataBricks.

Además, tendrás la oportunidad de identificar las necesidades de usuario y realizar labores de gestión de personas.




¿Qué necesitas saber?

Grado en Ingeniería.
Al menos 2-3 años de experiencia profesional, ejerciendo labores de desarrollo y con conocimientos avanzados en .Net
Conocimientos técnicos necesarios: SQL, Databricks, Python, Power Automate, Power App, PowerQuery
Nivel de inglés: Intermedio




¿Qué valor añadido te podemos aportar?

Un gran ambiente de trabajo, tanto dentro como fuera de la oficina
Oportunidades internacionales y red de contactos global
Formación continua y plan de carrera a tu medida
Salario competitivo y plan de remuneración flexible
31 días laborables de vacaciones
La tarde de tu cumpleaños libre
Flexibilidad y posibilidad de teletrabajo
Acceso a Kteam, nuestra plataforma de bienestar, servicios, solidaridad y promociones
Los beneficios pueden variar para programas de becas y/o prácticas

Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Y es que cada persona tiene un valor único y especial que aportar a la firma.

Nuestros valores marcan la diferencia. Marca la diferencia, impulsa tu talento.

Title: Junior Consultant – Process Data Analyst
Description:
Protiviti is a multinational management consulting group, a leader in the analysis and design of Governance, Organization, and Control models. We help our clients explore new opportunities for development and value growth by identifying risks and defining the best management and control strategies. We have a significant international presence, with 80 offices and over 10,000 employees worldwide. In Italy, we have been operating since 2004 with 450 employees.




For our Milan office, we are seeking determined and proactive individuals who understand both our clients' businesses and the technologies they use. You'll be part of our multi-disciplinary Digital team from day one, making impactful contributions.




Role Overview




We are looking for graduates in technical disciplines who will join our Digital team and launch their career within the Product & Service Industry (es: Food and Beverage, Manufacturing, Construction, Automotive..). You will support all the phases of Data Analytics and Process Mining projects:




Managing end-to-end Data Analytics / Process Mining initiatives across various clients and industries
Running data identification, extraction and transformation (ETL)
Connecting Data Analytics / Process Mining tools to client’s IT systems
Designing and developing process monitoring dashboards
Analyzing and interpreting the findings
Identifying bottlenecks and areas of improvement
Leveraging on Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to automate improvements
Drawing actionable conclusions and recommendations




Required Technical Skills & Experience:




Graduate in Statistics, Applied Math, Economics, Information Management, Computer Science, Management Engineering or related fields
Proven previous experience as a Data Scientist / Data Engineer / Data Analyst
Hands-on experience with one or more Data Analytics (Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc) and Process Mining tools (Celonis, Signavio etc.)
Skills in data manipulation and/or scripting (SQL, Python)
Able to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation
Experience in process analysis and improvement




Preferential requirements are:




1-2 years of experience in leading consulting firms or in leading international system integrators as a Data Scientist or Data Engineer or Data Analyst:

Familiarity with at least one enterprise suite (SAP, ServiceNow, Oracle etc.) is a big plus
Functional knowledge of financial and/or business processes (Procurement, Sales, Accounting, Logistics…) is a plus
Knowledge of Python highly appreciated




Basic requirements in the selection are the excellent knowledge of the Italian and English languages (both oral and written), interpersonal and communicative skills, experience of team management and relations with company management as well as ability to travel based on client requests/commitments.




Protiviti is an equal opportunity employer, which values diversity and inclusion. We establish an open, transparent, and merit-based recruitment process that ensures equal opportunities to all job applicants, free of any direct or indirect discrimination, in compliance with best international standards and applicable law (including but not limited to L. 903/77).

Show more
HTML:
Protiviti is a multinational management consulting group, a leader in the analysis and design of Governance, Organization, and Control models. We help our clients explore new opportunities for development and value growth by identifying risks and defining the best management and control strategies. We have a significant international presence, with 80 offices and over 10,000 employees worldwide. In Italy, we have been operating since 2004 with 450 employees.


For our Milan office, we are seeking determined and proactive individuals who understand both our clients' businesses and the technologies they use. You'll be part of our multi-disciplinary Digital team from day one, making impactful contributions.


Role Overview


We are looking for graduates in technical disciplines who will join our Digital team and launch their career within the Product & Service Industry (es: Food and Beverage, Manufacturing, Construction, Automotive..). You will support all the phases of Data Analytics and Process Mining projects:


  • Managing end-to-end Data Analytics / Process Mining initiatives across various clients and industries
  • Running data identification, extraction and transformation (ETL)
  • Connecting Data Analytics / Process Mining tools to client’s IT systems
  • Designing and developing process monitoring dashboards
  • Analyzing and interpreting the findings
  • Identifying bottlenecks and areas of improvement
  • Leveraging on Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to automate improvements
  • Drawing actionable conclusions and recommendations


Required Technical Skills & Experience:


  • Graduate in Statistics, Applied Math, Economics, Information Management, Computer Science, Management Engineering or related fields
  • Proven previous experience as a Data Scientist / Data Engineer / Data Analyst
  • Hands-on experience with one or more Data Analytics (Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc) and Process Mining tools (Celonis, Signavio etc.)
  • Skills in data manipulation and/or scripting (SQL, Python)
  • Able to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation
  • Experience in process analysis and improvement


Preferential requirements are:


1-2 years of experience in leading consulting firms or in leading international system integrators as a Data Scientist or Data Engineer or Data Analyst:

  • Familiarity with at least one enterprise suite (SAP, ServiceNow, Oracle etc.) is a big plus
  • Functional knowledge of financial and/or business processes (Procurement, Sales, Accounting, Logistics…) is a plus
  • Knowledge of Python highly appreciated


Basic requirements in the selection are the excellent knowledge of the Italian and English languages (both oral and written), interpersonal and communicative skills, experience of team management and relations with company management as well as ability to travel based on client requests/commitments.


Protiviti is an equal opportunity employer, which values diversity and inclusion. We establish an open, transparent, and merit-based recruitment process that ensures equal opportunities to all job applicants, free of any direct or indirect discrimination, in compliance with best international standards and applicable law (including but not limited to L. 903/77).

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Insights Analyst




Primark exists to serve the ‘Savvy Shoppers’ of the world, creating MAXIMUM JOY AT MINIMUM COST. We make LOOKING GOOD and FEELING GOOD cost less. With a culture of maximum care: for our customers and colleagues, our partners and the planet. With minimum waste, damage or disrespect. We are PRIMARK.




We are a £9bn+ turnover business with operations across 400+ stores and 16 international markets (and growing). Over the past 15 years, we’ve transformed into a true Retail giant with a global footprint that covers 16 selling markets and now employs over 80,000 colleagues worldwide.




We are a newly formed team within Primark, at the start of an exciting journey to integrate insights into the business to drive performance.

Our mission is to drive insight-led decision making for maximum impact in helping Primark achieve its strategic goals.




Our team will be structured in three pillars covering 1) Market, 2) Consumer and 3) Customer Insight. This role will be gathering feedback from our customers in all markets, analysing that feedback and preparing insights to share with the business. This role will be responsible for supporting the market and customer pillars.




What You’ll Get




The world is changing and it’s important we support our colleagues. People are at the heart of what we do at Primark so it’s essential we provide the right environment for you to perform at your best. That’s why we offer benefits that put you first




Some of our benefits are:

27 days of leave, plus bank holidays and if you want, you can buy 5 more.
Flexible Working, opportunity for an early Friday finish, and a subsidised cafeteria.
Primark Perks – Discounts with some local partner business to our offices




What You’ll Do:

In your role, you’ll collaborate with different people across a range of skillsets. Here’s a flavour of your day-to-day:




Market

Utilise market intelligence sources across markets (including consumer panels, data aggregators, trend providers, forecasters, and economic analysts) to build compelling insight stories aligned to supporting Primark’s strategic goals.
Support in building Primark’s capability in understanding market trends and their impact on the long-term market outlook to identify potential threats and opportunities.
Collaborate with product business partners as key partners to the Buying & Merchandising teams to scope category specific analysis.




Customer

Working day to day on our continuous customer feedback programmes.
Analyse data received through customer feedback and identify trends to feed into recommendations that could have an impact on customer experience and commerciality of the brand.
Support in automating and executing customer reports on recurring basis for all channels (In store, Online, Digital etc).




What You’ll Bring

Here at Primark, we want everyone to feel valued – so please bring your authentic self to work, of course with some other key experience and abilities for this role in particular:




Knowledge of the difference between qualitative and quantitative research and when/how to use them.
Problem solver with some experience of gathering and analysing data
Derive insight from data and identifying visual ways to deliver the insight in a compelling story.
Highly organised – can demonstrate strong project management skills and maintain reference documents, logs and processes.
Proactive, dynamic, self starter.
Works well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.




Ready? Good - because we can’t wait to see what you can offer. You’ll be joining a team of diverse, passionate, and talented individuals where you’ll truly belong, collaborating on projects that will shape the future of our industry. If you’re excited about this role but don’t meet all the criteria, we encourage you to apply. You may be the right candidate for this role or another one, and our recruitment team Can determine where your skills may fit in at Primark.




Apply to be part of our future and we’ll help you develop yours.




If you need any reasonable adjustments or have an accessibility requests, during your recruitment journey, such as extended time or breaks between online assessments, a sign language interpreter, mobility access, or assistive technology please contact your talent acquisition specialist.




All offers of employment are subject to background checks, including right to work, reference education and for some roles criminal, and financial checks. If you have any concerns please reach out to our talent acquisition team to discuss

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst (Python)
Description:
Data Analyst (Python) – 2/3 Years of Experience

Full-time – Groningen, NL

Are you an experienced Data Analyst with a passion for Python and a keen interest in marketing, media, and technology? Do you thrive on turning complex data into actionable insights for some of the world’s most renowned brands? If you have 2-3 years of experience and are looking to take your career to the next level, we invite you to join our dynamic team at MeMo² (a Kantar Company).

About Us

At MeMo², we work with some of the biggest names in the industry—think Uber, Nike, Asics, Amazon, and more. Our team of young professionals is dedicated to delivering top-tier marketing and market research insights that help these global giants optimize their day-to-day marketing expenses and strategies. From our cozy office overlooking the canals in the heart of Groningen, we combine cutting-edge data analysis with a deep understanding of market dynamics to drive real results for our clients.

About the Role

As an experienced Data Analyst at MeMo², you’ll play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decisions by leading advanced data analysis projects. Your work will directly influence how major Dutch and international brands understand their market positioning and effectiveness. We’re looking for someone who not only excels in technical skills but also brings a proactive approach to problem-solving and innovation in data analytics.

Key Responsibilities

Lead Data Analysis: Conduct advanced data analyses using Python, leveraging our custom frameworks to deliver actionable insights.
Project Setup & Management: Take ownership of new projects, from conceptualization to execution, ensuring alignment with client objectives.
Client-Focused Insights: Provide major brands like Uber, Nike, and Amazon with deep insights that help optimize their marketing spend and strategy.
Data Visualization & Reporting: Create and enhance PowerBI dashboards, and present data in a clear, impactful way to internal and external stakeholders.
Automation & Pipeline Development: Develop and implement data automation processes using Python, Azure Functions, and other relevant tools to streamline operations.
Market Modeling & Insights: Apply advanced data analysis techniques, such as market modeling, to provide deep insights into market trends and media effectiveness.

Qualifications

Experience: 2-3 years of professional experience in data analysis with Python, including project management and client-facing roles.
Technical Proficiency: Strong experience with Python (pandas, NumPy, etc.), data automation (e.g., Azure Functions), and familiarity with data pipeline development.
Data Visualization: Experience with PowerBI or similar tools, with the ability to create and revamp dashboards for optimal use.
Educational Background: A degree in Consumer Psychology, Communication, Marketing/Media, Data Science, or a related field.
Communication Skills: Fluent in English or Dutch, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Cultural Fit: A genuine interest in marketing, media, and technology, with the ability to thrive in a young, energetic team.

Why Join Us?

Exciting Projects: Work directly with some of the world’s largest and most influential brands, providing insights that drive global marketing strategies.
Vibrant Office Location: Work from our cozy office at a canal in the city center of Groningen, with a breathtaking view of the city’s landmarks.
Team Culture: Join a team of like-minded young professionals, with regular Friday afternoon drinks, office outings, and an extended lunch every day.
Growth Opportunities: Take on challenging projects and continuously develop your skills in a supportive, innovative environment.




Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!

At InnoTech, it’s all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us – growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.

For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!

Join our team of 160+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.




Your Mission Will Be

Supporting datamart migration activities, automating processes and centralising information modules.




You Will Need

At least 2 years' professional experience in similar positions;
Experience with datamarts;
Expertise in developing ETL processes (SSIS);
Comfortable with multidimensional modelling concepts;
CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.




Would Be Awesome If You Have

BSc or MSc in Computer Engineering or similar;
Knowledge of Power BI is highly valued;
Fluency in English (Spoken and Written).




With Us You Can Be a

TechThinker – people who want to re-imagine technology with us
TechSolver – strategic, resilient, and little bit a puzzle lover
InnoMinder – inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
InnoTecher – no words needed. Just happiness, talent and all the above!




Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Basic Function:

The successful candidate will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and reporting on various types of data, such as sales, marketing, operations, finance, and customer feedback. The resource will support to enhancement of the IT team in Ivrea.




Key responsibilities:

Extract, transform, and load data from various sources, such as databases from various systems, files, and APIs.
Analyze data using descriptive and inferential statistics, data visualization, and business intelligence tools.
Overseeing end-to-end process evaluation and operational excellence.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and presentations that communicate key insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
Use Qlik to develop and deploy interactive and user-friendly data applications.
Collaborate with other teams and departments to understand their data needs and provide solutions.
Contribute to the overarching Business Intelligence strategy.
Ensure data quality, accuracy, and consistency across all data sources and platforms.
Stay updated on the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in data analysis and data science.




Mandatory Qualifications:

Bachelor’s or master’s degree (or comparable qualification) in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience (3-5 years) in data analysis, data visualization, and data-driven decision making.
Strong knowledge and skills in Qlik (e.g., Qlik Sense or QlikView), including data modeling, scripting, expression writing, and dashboard development.
Proficiency in SQL and other data manipulation languages and tools.
Experience in working with various types of data, such as structured, unstructured, and semi-structured data.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts and findings to non-technical audiences.
Fluent English and Italian is a must.




Beneficial experience and requirement:

Certification or training in Qlik Sense, QlikView, or related technologies.
Knowledge or hands-on experience with other data analysis and data science tools, such as Python, R, Tableau, Power BI, or SAS.
Experience in applying machine learning, artificial intelligence, or advanced analytics techniques to data problems.
Experience in working with automotive or (discrete) manufacturing data.
Experience in creating and delivering reports and dashboards using Nprinting.




Work environment:

We offer a permanent contract, a dynamic and fast-growing business, a lean organization where you have the chance to be visible and appreciated by the top management, a global approach to people management. Availability to work on the Ivrea or Springdale Plant, in a young and fast-paced context, collaboration, and opportunities for growth.

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Qui sommes-nous ?




Depuis 2016, nous accompagnons nos clients sur des problématiques de Product Management, Data et Design Thinking.




Beelix contribue aux grandes avancées dans les secteurs suivants :

🚗 Automobile

⚡ Energie

📡 Médias & Télécoms

👗 Luxe & Retail

💲 Banque, Finance & Assurance

✈ Défense




Aujourd’hui, Beelix compte plus de 200 collaborateurs motivés et dynamiques.

Labélisée Great Place To work en 2023, Beelix est aussi une entreprise engagée où il fait bon vivre.




Dans le cadre de notre développement, nous recherchons actuellement un Data Analyst à Lille.




Vos missions au quotidien :




Fournir un appui analytique pour l'exploration et l'analyse complexe de données.
Créer des algorithmes de recherche de données permettant d'explorer et d'identifier les données utiles.
Industrialiser les procédés pour les données les plus intéressantes afin d'optimiser leur utilisation.
Organiser, synthétiser et traduire les informations pour faciliter la prise de décision.
Gérer les opérations, l'administration, la modélisation et l'architecture des gisements de données.
Assurer le bon fonctionnement et la cohérence des bases de données existantes.




A propos de vous :




3+ années d'expérience en tant que Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Maîtrise des outils d'analyse de données tels que SQL, Python, R, et des logiciels de visualisation de données comme Tableau ou Power BI.
Solide connaissance des techniques et méthodes statistiques.
Expérience dans l'industrialisation des procédés de traitement de données.
Aptitude à organiser, synthétiser et traduire les données de manière claire et concise.
Forte capacité analytique et goût pour les défis techniques.
Bonnes compétences en communication pour traduire les résultats de manière compréhensible pour les équipes non techniques.
Esprit d'équipe et capacité à travailler de manière autonome.
Anglais courant.




Beelix c’est aussi une structure qui propose :




Un suivi et un accompagnement au quotidien ( points réguliers, déjeuners…)
Un organisme de formation certifié Qualiopi, un abonnement linkedin learning pour chaque salarié et des partenariats avec des spécialistes pour d’autres expertises
De nombreux événements : Afterworks, Communautés métiers, Happy talks…
une Expérience personnalisée basée sur vos besoins grâce au Prédictive Index
Notre package « unBeelievable » : 100% du titre de transport, CSE, Prime de participation...




Vous vous reconnaissez dans cette offre ? N'hésitez plus, postulez chez nous !

Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate closely with our dynamic teams and working on multiple tasks. You will play an important role in creating engaging and insightful data visualizations using Tableau, using advanced data analysis and modelling techniques to find valuable trends and patterns within our datasets. Your involvement in developing and maintaining data models, reports, and workflows will be crucial to our success. Furthermore, you will actively engage with various business units, gaining a deep understanding of their unique needs and creating customized dashboards and solutions to meet and exceed their expectations.

About The Project

You should be already based in The Netherlands

Duration: 2-3 months

The Project Contains 2 Parts Of Development


The backend (data warehouse ) using the in-house data centre to develop a solution from data collocation to structured database (in storge ) ,
The frontend (visualisation ) : using the structured database in storge with the Tableau we cerate advance models flows in addition to build the dashboard visualizations.


What are the expectations/requirements?

You are already based in The Netherlands


Re-creation of existing dashboard and visualizations from PowerBI to tableau.
Creating data models from database using tableau Prep for visualizations
Creating new deep dives upon request
Interacting with multiple stakeholders to understand their requirements and implementing them in their dashboards
Gaid and support the stakeholders to understand and unlock the potential dashboard
Creating appealing dashboards and visualization, knowledge of UXUI would be nice


Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with the data solutions team to design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions
Create interactive and insightful data visualizations using Tableau
Perform complex data analysis and modelling to uncover trends, patterns, and insights using Tableau prep and SQL.
Assist in the development and maintenance of data pipelines and workflows
Discuss with business units (clients) to understand their needs and create dashboards tailored to their expectations
Contribute to the documentation of processes, methodologies, and best practices
Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and project planning activities


Want to know more about us?

We are serving the Swiss market as Switzerland’s leading IT & Telecom company. Thus, we are actively driving digitalization and networking, and tapping new paths for our customers and our employees. We do not know what the future is going to look like, but we definitely have the opportunity to shape it. To do so we are and act trustworthy, committed and curious.

Since 2019, we have been building up the coolest DevOps Center with a wonderful office at the World Trade Center in the heart of Rotterdam. We are currently recruiting IT passionate professionals who are keen on developing high-quality software, have an agile mindset and appreciate collaboration with motivated colleagues from all over the world.
