Title: Market Data Analyst
Description:
My client, a Global Investment Advisor, is seeking an individual Market Data Analyst to join a rapidly growing team within their vendor management department. This team plays a crucial role in ensuring the firms' relationships with their vendors are aligned with their strategic goals internally. The ideal candidate will have extensive market data experience within a buy-side firm, have hands-on experience, and knowledge of different market data vendors (Bloomberg, FactSet, S&P, etc.), and be able to serve as a subject matter expert for market data issues. This is a fully onsite role in Boston.




Responsibilities:

Manage relationships with market data vendors
Serve as the market data SME for market data issues, providing day-to-day consultative support to business users
Monitor, maintain, and manage market data spend, inventory, users, and usage
Coordinate invoice payments with the finance team and third parties
Manage vendors providing financial analysis, research reports, and analytical tools




Qualifications:

7+ years of Market Data experience in a buy-side firm
Bachelor's degree
In-depth knowledge of market data providers and analytics and research services




Benefits:

Competitive compensation package
Opportunity to join a new and growing team
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst in Boston $65,000
Description:
Marketing Data Analyst in Boston! $65,000 +

Company Overview

Join us at ProPivotal, where data meets dynamism, and your career aspirations thrive! With a prestigious 28-year legacy, we have established ourselves as the premier choice for staffing solutions among mid-size organizations in the Boston area.

We provide temporary staffing, direct-hire staffing, managed staffing, and recruitment process outsourcing staffing. As a recognized leader in the staffing industry, ProPivotal is not just a workplace – it's a pathway to professional excellence.

Why Work at ProPivotal

At ProPivotal, we're pioneers of talent solutions! Our secret sauce? Deep-rooted relationships and tailor-made services that keep our clients coming back for more.

Team Spirit: Say goodbye to the isolation of remote work! At ProPivotal, you'll find yourself surrounded by a team that's not just colleagues but companions in your professional journey. Together, we celebrate victories, overcome challenges, and forge bonds that last a lifetime.

Transparent Leadership: Our management team isn't just at the helm; they're alongside you, guiding, supporting, and empowering you every step of the way. Experience the transparency, integrity, and dedication of ProPivotal's leadership firsthand.

Unparalleled Training: At ProPivotal, learning never stops. We offer personalized support and invest in your growth. Get ready to earn your stripes with the Certified Staffing Professional Certificate from the American Staffing Association, backed by ProPivotal's unwavering support.

15 Years of Excellence: ProPivotal's commitment to excellence is not just a promise; it's a legacy. With 15 consecutive years of winning the Best of Staffing industry award, we set the benchmark for excellence in the staffing realm.

Marketing Data Analyst Responsibilities

As a Marketing Data Analyst at ProPivotal, you'll be at the forefront of our data-driven revolution. Dive deep into candidate applications, harness the power of data analytics, and unlock the full potential of candidate leads. Your responsibilities will include:


Interpreting data to optimize candidate utilization.
Crafting search parameters to match candidates with client job openings.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to address business needs.
Delivering insightful reports and presentations to senior management.


Who We're Looking For


Experience: Bring at least 3 years of related experience in a corporate environment to the table, with exposure to talent acquisition being a definite plus.
Analytical Acumen: Demonstrate a keen interest in analysis, with familiarity in tools like R or Python considered advantageous.
Critical Thinking: Possess superior critical thinking and analytical skills, coupled with an impeccable attention to detail.
Location:. Do you want to work in person in our Boston office. Our approach (100% in-office) is an important facilitator of staff development. We typically employ professionals who have an easy commute to our Boston Office (located near South Station).
Team Player: Enjoy and contribute to a positive team environment. We want someone who gets along with a variety of people/personalities and someone who can positively impact the work environment of peers, direct reports, leadership, and all employees. In plain English, someone who is free of drama and a pleasure to work with in good times and bad.


Join ProPivotal: We celebrate uniqueness and welcome everyone to the table, ProPivotal is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, color, religion, disability, veteran's status, sexual orientation, or any other protected factor. #pando3-2
Show more

Title: Summer Co-op 2025 - Data Analyst
Description:
Summer Co-op 2025 – Data Analyst - Burlington, MA

As a Summer Co-op 2025 – Data Analyst in Burlington, MA at Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP),

you will be a part of the beverage revolution. You will be working in a fast-paced, highly technical environment that produces some of KDP’s most popular beverages. Each co-op will lead high-impact projects and will be provided with opportunities to grow professionally. Come learn what it takes to succeed at an industry-leading company and help contribute to our ongoing success. While supporting the Supply Chain at KDP, your project work will include an opportunity to travel and work at a manufacturing site. You will see how it all comes together and how your work makes an impact.

Shift/Schedule:


The KDP 2025 Summer Co-op Program will run from July 9 - December 5, 2025
Full-time; 40 hours per week
Monday-Friday
8:00am until 5:00pm
Hybrid (T/W/Th in office)
Some travel may be required



As a Summer Co-op you will:


Gain knowledge in executing operational plans and projects, including data analytics and developing visualizations for DMS (Daily Management Systems) and QMS(Quality Management Systems).
Participate in AGILE project management and lead the development, verification, and testing of Data Analytics dashboards and visualization tools.
Influence software capabilities to achieve six sigma quality performance and enhance Quality Management System.
Assist with TPM (Total Productive Maintenance) implementation and Lean activities, including participation in Continuous Improvement or Kaizen events.
Analyzing Data from MES (manufacturing execution system) and quality inspection data to make process improvements
Audit findings data and action tracking visualizations



Elements of the KDP Co-op Program include:


Engaging and partnering on innovative projects to gain experience in a challenging, cross functional team environment
Participate in meet & greets and lunch & learns with KDP executives and other organization leaders
Receive professional development training such as networking, professional skills development and presenting
Be paired with a mentor to enhance your knowledge of other parts of the business and build your network
Complete a project from start to finish and present it and your takeaways to your team, department vice president and other KDP stakeholders



Total Rewards

Requirements


Must be an undergraduate currently enrolled in a full-time academic program from an accredited college or university, majoring in Information Technology, Data Analytics, Engineering or another related field
Available to work 40 hours per week (M-F, 8am-5pm)
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with a demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize requests, and meet deadlines
Strong communication skills including excellent listening, written, and verbal abilities
Ability to work cross-functionally, be independently driven, and a self-starter
Strong skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Tableau, Power BI, and SQL experience is preferred



Please note: This position is limited to persons with permanent right to work in the United States.

We incorporate HireVue, an automated interview tool, into our campus recruitment process. Please visit this link to learn more about HireVue and how to prepare. *We recommend checking with your campus career center for additional preparation resources such as InterviewStream, Big Interview and more

We work with big, exciting beverage brands and the #1 single-serve coffee brewing system in North America at KDP, and we have fun doing it!

Together, we have built a leading beverage company in North America offering hot and cold beverages together at scale. Whatever your area of expertise, at KDP you can be a part of a team that’s proud of its brands, partnerships, innovation, and growth. Will you join us?

We strive to be an employer of choice, providing a culture and opportunities that empower our team of ~28,000 employees to grow and develop. Title: Data Systems Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is seeking a Data Systems Analyst in Quincy, MA. Duties:


Access recertifications on a quarterly basis
Access provisioning through ticketing system
Access removals
Access transfers
Name changes processing
Process enhancements
Documentation for audit submissions
Help the business users with the submissions and clarification
Coordinate and work with various teams as a part of this process


Requirements


Experience with Jira and ServiceNow is required
Needs some audit experience
Understand the process
Understands SOC1 and SOC2
Has worked with ServiceNow/JIRA as a ticketing system
IAS access management
Has to keep track of all tickets and be able to provide ticketing information for any audit related request
Needs someone who can be plug and play with this type of standard in the environment
Needs to be an A player - takes full ownership


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

Title: Business / Data Analyst - LLJP00001538
Description:
Job Title: Business / Data Analyst

Job Location: Lexington MA 02420

Onsite Requirements:

Data Analysis
ATS experience
HR/TA experience

Job Description:

The Talent Management Program Analyst will provide business analytics, data analysis, drive small to mid-scale projects as well as process improvement initiatives.
This role will report to the Strategic Talent Project Manager.

Responsibilities:
Business Analysis

Analyzes data (internal, project, market, best practices) for trends and impacts (to the department, project, or Institute). Applies analyses to initiate, measure, monitor, and support resulting business initiatives.
Synthesizes analyses into compelling narratives that elicit stakeholder buy-in, alignment and execution
Collaborates with HRIS in the data and analytics (D&A) development process. Liaises between HRIS and business owners to understand and communicate the business need collect requirements, provide input and feedback on resulting D&A products.
Possesses subject matter expertise in SuccessFactors Recruiting module. Ability to configure SuccessFactors functionality to align and optimize business initiatives. Proactively works to optimize the use and functionality of the tool.
Ability to engage with stakeholders seeking to survey Laboratory personnel, collect requirements, and execute surveys. Assists with department survey strategy development and execution.
Analyzes survey results and able to learn survey platform tools. Leads or assists with action planning as a result of survey analyses.
Works closely with internal HR Analytics Team for workforce-related reporting assistance.
Supports Talent Management team in sourcing best practice research (Gartner, SHRM, etc.) and drafting major findings documents.

Project Management

Responsible for project planning activities for small to mid-size HR projects.
Provides project management support to project leads, including establishing project goals, setting timelines, and developing project plans. Manages deliverables and project execution activities including needs assessment, implementation, analytics, innovation, maintenance, and enhancements.
Support change management project objectives and implementation of risk mitigation strategies
Develops clear and effective meeting materials, presentations, and project documentation. Able to present and share those materials if called on to do so.
Proactively identifies and mitigates potential risks and issues.
Works with the HR Strategic Program Management as needed on strategic efforts and providing further PM support when needed
Fosters an environment of trust, collaboration, responsiveness, and accountability across both project and departmental teams.
Ensures transfer of knowledge and responsibilities to owning operational areas prior to close-out of projects.

Process Improvement

Supports the development of process maps/workflows to improve efficiency of HR processes.
Maintains and updates process-related documents using BusinessOptix and Visio.

Requirements:

3-5 years' experience in business/data analytics required
Previous experience in HR
Experience working with applicant tracking systems, ERP systems and customer relationship management systems.
Project administration and coordination experience utilizing proven project and process management skills, tools, and framework
Strong analytical skills demonstrated by eliciting complete and accurate requirements
Strong results-orientation, teamwork, communication, and interpersonal skills to navigate projects through a consensus-driven environment
Meeting management and facilitation skills, with the ability to follow through and drive progress through others
Strong PC skills (e.g., MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Smartsheet, MS Teams)

Preferred:

bachelor's degree
3-5 years' experience in project management/process improvement preferred
Experience with SuccessFactors and Yello systems considered a plus.

  • Support change management project objectives and implementation of risk mitigation strategies
  • Develops clear and effective meeting materials, presentations, and project documentation. Able to present and share those materials if called on to do so.
  • Proactively identifies and mitigates potential risks and issues.
  • Works with the HR Strategic Program Management as needed on strategic efforts and providing further PM support when needed
  • Fosters an environment of trust, collaboration, responsiveness, and accountability across both project and departmental teams.
  • Ensures transfer of knowledge and responsibilities to owning operational areas prior to close-out of projects.

Process Improvement

  • Supports the development of process maps/workflows to improve efficiency of HR processes.
  • Maintains and updates process-related documents using BusinessOptix and Visio.

Requirements:

  • 3-5 years' experience in business/data analytics required
  • Previous experience in HR
  • Experience working with applicant tracking systems, ERP systems and customer relationship management systems.
  • Project administration and coordination experience utilizing proven project and process management skills, tools, and framework
  • Strong analytical skills demonstrated by eliciting complete and accurate requirements
  • Strong results-orientation, teamwork, communication, and interpersonal skills to navigate projects through a consensus-driven environment
  • Meeting management and facilitation skills, with the ability to follow through and drive progress through others
  • Strong PC skills (e.g., MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Smartsheet, MS Teams)

Preferred:

  • bachelor's degree
  • 3-5 years' experience in project management/process improvement preferred
  • Experience with SuccessFactors and Yello systems considered a plus.

Title: Cybersecurity Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are currently seeking a cybersecurity data analyst to help us define problems, collect, transform and extract meaning from data, and build actionable conclusions for global cybersecurity (GCS) projects within the GCS metrics & reporting team. The position performs a wide range of activities with experts from GCS, data, business intelligence, governance, and other data analysts to collaboratively solve complex cybersecurity problems.

About The GCS Metrics & Reporting Team

The GCS metrics & reporting team is an exciting and growing area of cybersecurity with unique insight into the whole spectrum of our cybersecurity activity at State Street. The metrics team of data visualization and business intelligence experts is involved in the identification and implementation of key metrics, reports, and dashboards that provide visibility, insights, and accountability, identify trends in our cyber security controls, and inform our strategy and operations with audiences ranging from daily operational teams to the Board of Directors. As a cybersecurity data analyst within the GCS metrics and reporting team, you will have a significant opportunity to making a difference on the team, within the cybersecurity organization, as well as State Street overall.

What You Will Be Responsible For


Under direct supervision, define problems, collect relevant data, transform data, extract meaning from data, and draw logical and coherent conclusions across a wide array of Business Intelligence, data and data visualization tools
Assisting to build data models, query data sources, clean data, and synthesize analysis in clear language, accessible to both technical and non-technical audiences



What We Value


Strong communication skills (verbal and written)
Strong leadership, strategic and critical thinking skills with a proven track record of execution and delivery
Natural curiosity and empathy focused on our user’s needs, motivations and behaviors
Teamwork and collaboration across different roles, teams, and locations



Education & Preferred Qualifications


Strong experience with Python coding
Strong experience with relational and non-relational databases
Strong experience working with APIs
Strong experience with Databricks notebook development & SQL
Experience with wide range of data visualization tools, especially Microsoft Power BI
Familiarity with Agile project delivery, cloud computing, design thinking, cybersecurity metrics, business intelligence, data visualization best practices, accessibility



Salary Range

$90,000 - $142,500 Annual

The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

Job Application Disclosure

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

State Street's Speak Up Line

Title: Senior Business Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Senior Business Data Analyst(Must Have Data Governance Experience)

Location: Boston, MA (Day 1 Onsite)

Experience: 10+ Years

Work type: C2C only

PETADATA is currently looking to hire for the position of Senior Business Data Analyst for one of their clients.

Roles & Responsibilities


Experience in writing and understanding SQL queries Identify opportunities to accomplish project goals most efficiently and cost-effectively. Business Requirements Management and Solution Development.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to fully understand, define, and document business requirements for software and/or process changes through a variety of means focusing on medium to high-complexity projects, processes, and functional areas of the applications.
Conduct user interviews, surveys, workflow reviews, and research on industry best practices and user workshops documenting current(As-Is) and Future (To-Be) scenarios including processes, models, use cases, plans, flow diagrams, requirements write-ups, and solutions.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.


Required Skills


Data analysis skills with experience using enterprise tools such as Informatica, Ataccama, Collibra, and/or other metadata management tools and Delphix/Informatica or other data privacy/compliance tools.
Strong knowledge of and experience with GCP/AWS/Azure, SQL Server, Oracle, Snowflake, etc.
Must have experience with data governance as a practice, including enterprise data management, data lifecycle management, data anonymization & masking, data quality, data lineage, data privacy, data security, metadata management, data analytics and reporting, and artificial intelligence(AI).
Extensive understanding and experience in data governance and data initiatives and defining Data Retention strategy and objectives while enabling business values.
Drive and challenge business users on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans. Proactively identify ways in which system and process changes can improve the efficiency of key users, customer service, accuracy of results, and/or completeness of data.
Act as a change agent to help ensure that assumptions, development, and implementation of new systems/processes enhance the success of the project and increase the project’s alignment with the business needs.
Serve as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure that requirements are properly translated into technical specifications, clarify requirements, review recommendations, and answer questions.
Collaborate and build consensus between the technical team and stakeholders working to balance scope, speed to market, and available resources.
Ensure that all processes and documentation are consistent with best practices and Bright Horizons standards for the Solution Delivery Life Cycle.
Drive the development of a master test plan with the QE team that traces business requirements throughout the SDLC and ensures that all process steps are followed.
Work with Application Support, Training, Implementation, QE, and development in a business analysis capacity both reactively and proactively to support application issues, changes, and modifications.
Organize and lead projects from inception to execution including creating and managing task lists, project schedules, budget, etc.
Work effectively with vendors to fully scope and estimate initiatives that meet cost, scope, and timeline objectives and constraints.


Educational Qualification

Bachelor's/ Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

We offer a professional work environment and are given every opportunity to grow in the Information technology world.

Note

Candidates are required to attend Phone/Video Call / In-person interviews and after Selection of candidate (He/She) should go through all background checks on Education and Experience.

Please email your resume to: jhansib@petadata.co

After carefully reviewing your experience and skills one of our HR team members will contact you on the next steps.

Title: Data Processing Systems Analyst
Description:
Overview

The Boston Fire Department (BFD) seeks a Data and Performance Analyst to join the Information Technology Division at BFD. Under the direction and guidance of the Chief Technology Officer, the Analyst is an essential member of the division regarding all Fire IT data analytics. The Analyst’s work directly contributes to operational and technical improvements throughout the City of Boston Fire Department. The Analyst acts as a liaison to interact with the City’s Analytics Team, whose mission is to use data to improve the quality of life and enhance operations in the City of Boston. By combining historical incident information, personnel tracking system information from IBM Mainframe, formal and current CAD data, modern data analysis from Firehouse Software, and visualizations with a deeply engaged approach to performance improvement and change management, the Analyst works with Boston Fire Staff, Fire Alarm staff, Boston Police IT staff, vendors and other City Department’s Data Analysts to solve challenging problems and seek pertinent useful information to build toward a more effective paperless system and deliver better outcomes for the fire commanders and the first responders.

Responsibilities


Leads and supports the design, coordination, development, implementation, and maintenance of ongoing reports, requests, analysis, dashboards, and metrics for key operations and decision-making for BFD’s data.
Serves as a resource and content expert for the department in this process.
Works with BFD IT staff on maintaining and enhancing the Firehouse Software Incident Reporting System’s modules, incidents, hydrants, and analytics.
Assists the Fire Investigation Unit by enhancing and performing data analysis as needed for its exclusive database and troubleshooting problems that arise with users.
Administers, monitors, and reviews systems and data accuracy on a regular basis to ensure data validity and consistency of Boston Fire’s Incident Reporting System information.
Runs reports on a daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly basis and per request as needed.
Creates and provides results of fire incident data presenting on the dashboard for executives utilizing the Firehouse Software Analytics Module.
Communicates with and presents to executive leadership project results and findings; responds to ad-hoc requests as needed.
Serves as data coordinator and liaison between the BFD and other City departments.
Performs work as needed for BFD Public Information Requests for Information from the media or public received from BFD personnel and other City Agencies.
Coordinates and collaborates with other City agency staff to provide and collect BFD-related information needed to improve the City government with Open Data Portal.
Collaborates with Fire Department IT staff, Police IT staff and Fire Alarm staff to obtain Computer Aid Dispatch (CAD) incidents data to perform analytical work as needed.
Contributes and assists the City Analytics to build intelligence systems and combine data from many sources with the goal of providing firefighters up-to-todate hazard information en route to fire scenes.
Proactively builds and maintains positive and effective relationships with the City, Police Department, and Fire Departments’ counterparts.
Works with BFD’s users to analyze results, forecast current and future needs, assess performance, and evaluate strategic opportunities.
Works with Information Technology staff in the development of data warehouses and other data sources to support managerial and BFD reporting needs.
Assembles, manipulates and/ or formats data and/or reports utilizing various software applications such as Firehouse Software, desktop tools, Access, spreadsheets, report writing firehouse software, firehouse statistical software, graphical presentation tools and applications.
Assists IT staff with troubleshooting calls through telephone and by using Remote Desktop Tools as needed.
Performs related work as required.


Minimum Entrance Qualifications


A minimum of two (2) years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, professional experience in business or public administration, program management, or related field, in work that included reporting, dashboarding, and languages such as Firehouse Software or other Incident Reporting Solution, SQL, CAD, IBM Mainframe, Tableau.
Experience in a government setting is preferred.
A bachelor's degree in computer science is preferred and may be substituted for the required experience.
Must be able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and react to problems quickly.
Must be able to translate concepts and directions into practical solutions.
Experience with Microsoft Access, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Google Apps (docs, sheets, and slides) is strongly preferred.
Ability to exercise good judgment and focus on details as required by the job.
Ability to manage simultaneous assignments while maintaining a critical attention to detail.
Demonstrated ability to work on diverse teams and experience building strong relationships across a range of functional areas and seniority levels.
Proven verbal and written communication skills.
Proven organizational and project management skills.


Per-Employment Drug Test Required

Boston Residency Required

Terms:

Union/Salary/Grade: SENA/MM1-6

Hours per week: 35

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
What is Cirkul?

Cirkul is a rapidly growing beverage technology company on a mission to make a healthier world by helping people enjoy drinking more water.

The team at Cirkul developed an innovative beverage delivery system that makes drinking more water delicious, fun, and personalized. The technology reduces the shipping weight of bottled beverages by 96% and uses 84% less plastic. Cirkul offers its customers 100+ unique flavors, all with no sugar, zero calories, no artificial colors, and a range of functional enhancements online, at Walmart, and other retailers across the United States. Hundreds of thousands of consumers are using Cirkul to transition from single-use plastics and sugar-filled beverages to healthier, better-for-you alternatives.

What is this role?

As a Lead Data Analyst for Cirkul, you will be tackling challenges across Growth/Marketing, Finance, Retail, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and Customer Support teams to quickly deliver insights through analysis and experimentation, review and develop metrics, and develop business processes to scale analytics to support a hyper growth business. You will serve as the technical lead and resource for the entire data analytics team.

The ideal candidate must be able to roll up his/her sleeves to work independently and contribute to the output and results. He/she must have the ability to prioritize issues, deal with ambiguity and manage conflicting deadlines. The candidate should also be creative, data-driven, and aggressive in delivering results. Mentor and coach junior analysts on the team.

What does an average day look like?


Driving Results: Design and develop KPIs tracking business performance across departments. Build and automate tools to surface key data to stakeholders across a broad range of data literacy levels.
Taking Ownership: Monitor KPIs to identify potential opportunities to improve company performance.
Making Decisions: Collect, analyze, and explain data to key stakeholders and executive leadership.
Cultivating Relationships: Be a data evangelist: collaborate with both technical and non-technical teammates to supplement decisions with quantitative evidence.
Instilling Trust: Always auditing: build and maintain processes to track data and troubleshoot errors.
Customer Focus: Provide ad hoc analysis and forecasting as needed across a diverse set of teams. Evaluate reporting needs and work with key stakeholders to prioritize overall strategy of the data team in answering company goals.


What background should you have?


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Economics, Engineering, Finance, Math, or Statistics. Master’s preferred
Data-driven, detail-oriented individual with excellent analysis and problem-solving abilities
5+ years of DTC, Ecommerce, and/or Retail experience, preferred
Fluency in data analysis and data-driven problem solving; a track record of using data to communicate results to key stakeholders
Excellent verbal and written communication skills: the ability to present complex data in a digestible format to stakeholders of all data literacy levels
Fluency with advanced SQL and Python
Experience with experimentation and statistical analysis (e.g. causal inference)
Comfortable creating dashboards in a BI framework such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, or comparable tools
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously: superb time management and prioritization ability
Ability to work independently and autonomously, as well as part of a team


What do we offer?


Competitive salary based on experience and market
Generous benefits, 401k match, and PTO (even insurance for your fur babies!)
Employee discounts on Cirkul products
New corporate office space with great amenities
Opportunity to work with a best in class team, in a hyper growth company, taking over the hydration industry
A culture that rewards results


Please review our privacy policy here .

Cirkul, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and are committed to sustaining an equitable and inclusive, people-first environment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents.

Title: Statistical Data Analyst - Part Time
Description:
GENERAL SUMMARY/ OVERVIEW STATEMENT:Summarize the nature and level of work performed.

The Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) Corrigan Minehan Heart Center and Cardiovascular Research Center is seeking a highly motivated Statistical Data Analyst to work on multiple clinical and translational research projects focused on cardiovascular disease. The position will be a central investigator for high-impact research projects presented at international conferences and published in major medical journals. This position is part-time, 20 hours per week.

This Statistical Data Analyst position works with Principal Investigators (PIs) who are faculty members at Harvard Medical School and in the Divisions of Cardiology and Cardiac Surgery at MGH. Investigators and analysts work as members of a collaborative multidisciplinary team of clinicians, scientists, and trainees. Under the supervision of a PIs, the selected candidate will lead data analyses for projects related to heart disease and is expected to leverage conventional and advanced data science/machine learning approaches in the analysis of high-dimensional clinical datasets. This work often involves advanced causal inference methods including econometric techniques.Additional responsibilities include developing research protocols, compiling data, managing databases, performing quality assurance, validating programming, and generating outputs and visuals that summarize study results.

The selected candidate will also contribute to the preparation of manuscripts, conference abstracts, and other publications, as well as assist in coordinating collaborative research activities with internal and external investigators. Strong communication skills and the ability to convey statistical concepts in simpler and relatable terms is highly desired.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Indicate key areas of responsibility, major job duties, special projects and key objectives for this position.These items should be evaluated throughout the year and included in the written annual evaluation.

The Statistical Data Analyst has the following duties and responsibilities:


Lead the efficient synthesis and analysis of clinical data for all assigned projects related to cardiovascular disease.
Participate in study design meetings with internal and external investigators, providing guidance on sample size requirements, approaches to measurement, and clinical endpoints.
Assist with preparation of IRB submissions and renewals.
Assist investigators in the development and implementation of statistical analysis plans, ensuring analytical activities are within scope, timeline, and reach the overall aims of each project.
Participate in the preparation and presentation of study results in manuscripts, conference abstracts, or other publication mediums.
Coordinate and participate in collaborations with investigators within other Harvard departments and at other institutions across the U.S.
Participate in and report on assigned project status at bi-weekly team meetings.
Actively participate in continuing education and mentorship of other research team members.
Proactively conduct quality control/quality assurance of programming and statistical models, automating processes whenever possible.
Assists with other research-related tasks as needed.


SKILLS/ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES REQUIRED:Must be realistic, objective, measurable and related to essential functions of this job.

Position Requirements


A Masters degree in statistics, biostatistics, mathematics, or a related field is required.
Proficiency in biostatistical methods such as quasi-experimental methods appropriate for analysis of complex, observational datasets (claims data, observational cohorts, and clinical trial data); survival analysis; regression; dimension reduction and methods appropriate for clustering and panel data; and machine learning is required.
Experience in econometric statistical techniques including instrumental variables methods and regression discontinuity is required.
Proficiency in oral and written English communication is required.
Experience and proficiency in one or more of the following statistical programming languages is required: Python, R, SAS, NCSS, MPlus, SPSS, and Stata.


Skills/Competencies That Are Highly Desired


Experience and proficiency in prioritizing tasks and requesting support (when needed) while adhering to project deadlines is highly desired.
An ability to convey complex statistical concepts to a diverse team of clinical professionals with a varying levels of expertise in statistics is highly desired.
Experience in new machine learning platforms such as Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch is highly desired.
Experience in implementing Bayesian analysis is highly desired.


LICENSES, CERTIFICATIONS, and/or REGISTRATIONS (if applicable):Specify minimum credentials and clearly indicate if preferred or required

EDUCATION: Specify minimum education and clearly indicate if preferred or required


Minimum education required: A Masters degree in statistics, biostatistics, mathematics, or a related field is required


EXPERIENCE: Specify minimum creditable years of experience and clearly indicate if preferred or required


None; if newly graduating from graduate school, prefer course experience in advanced statistical methods and machine learning


SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY (if applicable):List the number of FTEs supervised.


None.


FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY (if applicable):Indicate financial “scope” information, i.e.: size of budget, volume, revenue, etc.; Indicate total physician/non-physician FTE scope


None


WORKING CONDITIONS: Describe the conditions in which the work is performed.


Duties will be performed remotely and in an office setting.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

Pay Range: $70hr - $75hr

Responsibilities:
Data Analysis: Utilize SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data from our databases to identify trends, insights, and opportunities.
Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business and product requirements, ensuring a clear understanding of goals and objectives.
Product Development Support: Assist in the development of product roadmaps, feature prioritization, and user stories based on data-driven findings. E.g.
The purpose of this is to assist the product manager with providing data for features in Generative AI products we are building and deploying.
Value and Metrics Tracking: Define and track key performance indicators (OKRs, KPIs) to measure the success of AI Product performance.
Dashboards: Build and maintain data visualizations and dashboards in AWS Quick Sight or Tableau to present general data findings as well as creating systems to track AI product model performance.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with AI engineering, UX/UI design,
marketing, and other teams to ensure alignment and successful project implementation.
Required Skills:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Computer Science, Engineering) or equivalent experience.
2 to 4 years hands-on work experience as a Data Analyst in a tech startup or a digital transformation and innovation organization.
Proficiency in writing SQL queries.
Experience using Python libraries to create data visualizations (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly etc).
Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques.
Experience with a dashboarding tool like AWS Quicksight or Tableau.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to present analysis/narrative to various groups.
Nice to Have:
Experience in AI-Powered and Generative AI (LLM) products a plus.
Experience with Sagemaker is a plus.
Experience with user analysis tools like Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics or similar.
Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies.

Title: MDM Data Analyst
Description:
MDM Data Analyst

Somerville, MA - Hybrid




Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

Work with other scrum team members on ingestion of data into Profisee, a cloud based PAAS application hosted in our Azure Kubernetes environment
Develop and maintain matching strategies and data quality rules
Data Stewardship functions and administering the data stewardship model
Gather business requirements and convert to technical requirements.
Where possible, ensure development of attributes and MDM reference data is aligned with healthcare data best practices (FHIR, HL7, DaVinci, etc.)
Management of MDM reference data and crosswalks in Profisee
Develops and mentors other staff members; develops advanced expertise in tools and shares best practices.




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science preferred
Experience in healthcare related business processes related to medical staff offices, provider onboarding, or ambulatory and hospital operations
2 years or more of experience in Master Data Management - Strategy, roadmap, systems analysis, and application design
1 or more years of experience with MDM tools (Profisee Master Data Management, MDStaff or similar MDM platforms), experience in Profisee MDM preferred.
Data quality, data governance and metadata management understanding; Experience with Collibra and/or Informatica preferred.

Hi Marley is the first intelligent conversational platform built for P&C insurance and powered by SMS. Designed by insurance professionals, Hi Marley enables lovable, convenient conversations across the entire ecosystem, saving money and time for carriers while building customer loyalty through delightful interactions. Hi Marley's industry-leading collaboration, coaching and analytics capabilities deliver crucial insights that streamline carrier operations while enabling a frictionless customer engagement experience. The solution is made for the enterprise; it’s fast to deploy, easy to use and seamlessly integrates with core insurance systems. Through its advanced conversational technology, Hi Marley reduces friction – empowering innovative carriers to reinvent the customer and employee experience.





We’re on a mission to redefine data-driven insights in the insurance industry. We’re looking for a talented Senior Data Analyst to be a key player in our growing data and analytics team. In this role, you'll help shape our data landscape by contributing to the creation of an innovative and cutting-edge data enterprise solution. You’ll work closely with our product, finance, and customer teams to turn data into actionable insights, manage the transformation layer, and refine our data pipelines. Title: Bioinformatics Analyst II
Description:
Job Summary

As the largest staffing and recruitment agency in the world, we can commit to finding you the perfect role that gives you the opportunity to learn and grow in the life sciences arena. Utilizing a recruiter for your job search gives you access to a large network of top employers as well as detailed information about hundreds of positions. A current top partnership with a research-driven biopharmaceutical company is known as a powerhouse that aims to develop treatments for difficult-to-cure diseases. This renowned employer has created 32 products, including Humira and Lupron, that have highly impacted lives across the globe. If you're looking to stand out in your field and lead the way to innovative therapies, this position is for you!

location: Cambridge, Massachusetts

job type: Contract

salary: $ per hour

work hours: 9 to 5

education: Masters

Responsibilities


Build a Single-Cell Atlas: Utilize publicly available single-cell datasets to build comprehensive single-cell atlases, enhancing our understanding of cellular heterogeneity in immune system and disease contexts.
Analyze Single-Cell Data: Assist in the analysis of single-cell RNA-seq, TCR-seq, and BCR-seq data to identify disease-associated regulatory networks and biomarkers.
Support Multi-Omics Integration: Help integrate various omics data (e.g., gene expression, proteomics) to gain insights into disease mechanisms and identify potential drug targets.
Develop Machine Learning Models: Contribute to the development and implementation of machine learning models for data analysis and target identification.
Communicate Findings: Support the team in interpreting results and presenting scientific data to both internal and external stakeholders.
Collaborate with Teams: Work with cross-functional teams to leverage computational methods in therapeutic development.


Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in bioinformatics, computer science, computational biology, or a related field.
Some experience in a relevant academic or industry setting is preferred.
Proficiency in programming languages, particularly Python, with a solid understanding of data analysis and visualization techniques.
Familiarity with omics data types (e.g., RNA-seq) and basic machine learning concepts.
Strong problem-solving skills and a desire to learn.


Preferred Qualifications


Exposure to immunology or experience with biological data analysis.
Familiarity with cloud computing and data management environments.
Collaborative work style and effective communication skills.


skills: R Language

This posting is open for thirty (30) days.

Title: Data Analyst - Office of Jury Commissioner
Description:
Data Analyst - Office of Jury Commissioner - (240007W0)

Description

ALL APPLICANTS MUST APPLY DIRECTLY THROUGH THE TRIAL COURT EMPLOYMENT PAGE LINKED BELOW.

https://trialcourtjobs.mass.gov/jobs/data-analyst-office-of-jury-commissioner-boston-massachusetts-united-states

IF YOU APPLY THROUGH THE APPLY ONLINE LINK ABOVE ON THIS MASS CAREERS PAGE YOU WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION.

PLEASE USE THE FOLLOWING LINK TO APPLY (CUT AND PASTE INTO YOUR BROWSER IF THE EMBEDDED LINK DOES NOT WORK):

https://trialcourtjobs.mass.gov/jobs/data-analyst-office-of-jury-commissioner-boston-massachusetts-united-states

If you only receive an email from MassCareers, you HAVE NOT successfully applied. Please call 617-742-8575 with any questions.

You have successfully applied to the position when you receive an email from the Massachusetts Trial Court.

Departmental Mission Statement: The core mission of the Office of Jury Commissioner (OJC) is to provide randomly-selected pools of eligible jurors, representative of the community from which they are drawn, to each of the jury courts of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, in accordance with the needs of those courts and the direction of the Trial Court. The OJC is committed to educating the public on the value and responsibility of serving as a juror, and to providing courteous, professional service to the public and the courts.

Organizational Profile

http://www.mass.gov/courts/jury/index2.htm

Notes

Position Summary: Working within the Office of Jury Commissioner, the Data Analyst coordinates the collection and analysis of organizational data for use in process analysis and optimization. Presents findings in regular reports and presentations for use in leadership decision-making. Conducts research, as needed, and applies data to design new standards for optimizing efficiency of operations. Responds to customized requests for data compilation and analysis.

Supervision Received: Works under the direction of the Network and Information Services Manager.

Duties: Manages departmental data for reporting and quarterly metrics;

Create and maintain dashboards highlighting key performance indicators; Collects, organizes, analyzes, writes, and distributes periodic data reports;

Produces regularly distributed standard internal and external statistical reports quarterly and annually;

Presents and distributes data findings to stakeholders as necessary;

Reviews internal databases and external sources to complete statistical calculations;

Builds out and prepares statewide statistical data reports on demand for information dissemination and other uses; Performs or assists with special projects and writes reports as requested;

Performs research for specific programs and court initiatives; and

Job Competencies

Performs other duties as required.

Ethics and Values: Communicates and demonstrates the ethics and values of the Trial Court.

Mission Driven: Employees are fully committed to fulfilling the Trial Court and associated Departmental missions.

Professional Development: Employees are committed to participating in ongoing Trial Court training and educational offerings to advance their professional development. Managers are equally committed to affording those opportunities to those they supervise as scheduling permits.

Customer Service: Conducts oneself in a courteous and professional manner towards both Trial Court employees and the public.

Applied Knowledge: Ability to communicate and present data and research findings such as graphs, tables, and technical briefs.

Problem Solving: Ability to successfully address research issues, draw conclusions and make recommendations based on the research and policy analysis results.

Commitment to Diversity: Promotes an environment of diversity through understanding, respect, and positive communication with persons of varied racial, ethnic, economic, and cultural backgrounds.

Collaboration: Works with others cooperatively, and promotes teamwork, contributing to a work environment that focuses on shared departmental goals.

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements:

Education And Experience


Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university (statistics-oriented degree is preferred)
Two (2) years of related work experience
Equivalent combinations of education and experience will be considered for meeting minimum qualifications


Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities


Jury and court system processes and procedures preferred, but not required
Data analysis and related mathematical and statistical principles
Research design methodology
Systems operational procedures, including planning, management, and data analysis techniques
Excel and other statistical reporting software
PowerPoint
Familiarity with programs such as Oracle and Tableau preferred, but not required
Attention to detail
Organization and prioritization
Complex problem solving
Verbal and written communication, including technical writing and communication
Training
Public speaking
Assimilate statistical information, identify and analyze trends, and track large volumes of numerical data
Recognize data anomalies
Interact with the public
Communicate clearly and persuasively with top management
Handle multiple projects simultaneously
Set and meet deadlines


Employment with the Trial Court is contingent upon passage of a criminal record check.

Departmental Mission Statement: The core mission of the Office of Jury Commissioner (OJC) is to provide randomly-selected pools of eligible jurors, representative of the community from which they are drawn, to each of the jury courts of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, in accordance with the needs of those courts and the direction of the Trial Court. The OJC is committed to educating the public on the value and responsibility of serving as a juror, and to providing courteous, professional service to the public and the courts.

Organizational Profile

http://www.mass.gov/courts/jury/index2.htm

Notes

Position Summary: Working within the Office of Jury Commissioner, the Data Analyst coordinates the collection and analysis of organizational data for use in process analysis and optimization. Presents findings in regular reports and presentations for use in leadership decision-making. Conducts research, as needed, and applies data to design new standards for optimizing efficiency of operations. Responds to customized requests for data compilation and analysis.

Supervision Received: Works under the direction of the Network and Information Services Manager.

Duties: Manages departmental data for reporting and quarterly metrics;

Create and maintain dashboards highlighting key performance indicators; Collects, organizes, analyzes, writes, and distributes periodic data reports;

Produces regularly distributed standard internal and external statistical reports quarterly and annually;

Presents and distributes data findings to stakeholders as necessary;

Reviews internal databases and external sources to complete statistical calculations;

Builds out and prepares statewide statistical data reports on demand for information dissemination and other uses; Performs or assists with special projects and writes reports as requested;

Performs research for specific programs and court initiatives; and

Job Competencies

Performs other duties as required.

Ethics and Values: Communicates and demonstrates the ethics and values of the Trial Court.

Mission Driven: Employees are fully committed to fulfilling the Trial Court and associated Departmental missions.

Professional Development: Employees are committed to participating in ongoing Trial Court training and educational offerings to advance their professional development. Managers are equally committed to affording those opportunities to those they supervise as scheduling permits.

Customer Service: Conducts oneself in a courteous and professional manner towards both Trial Court employees and the public.

Applied Knowledge: Ability to communicate and present data and research findings such as graphs, tables, and technical briefs.

Problem Solving: Ability to successfully address research issues, draw conclusions and make recommendations based on the research and policy analysis results.

Commitment to Diversity: Promotes an environment of diversity through understanding, respect, and positive communication with persons of varied racial, ethnic, economic, and cultural backgrounds.

Collaboration: Works with others cooperatively, and promotes teamwork, contributing to a work environment that focuses on shared departmental goals.

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements:

Education And Experience

  • Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university (statistics-oriented degree is preferred)
  • Two (2) years of related work experience
  • Equivalent combinations of education and experience will be considered for meeting minimum qualifications

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

  • Jury and court system processes and procedures preferred, but not required
  • Data analysis and related mathematical and statistical principles
  • Research design methodology
  • Systems operational procedures, including planning, management, and data analysis techniques
  • Excel and other statistical reporting software
  • PowerPoint
  • Familiarity with programs such as Oracle and Tableau preferred, but not required

  • Organization and prioritization
  • Complex problem solving

  • Recognize data anomalies
  • Interact with the public
  • Communicate clearly and persuasively with top management
  • Handle multiple projects simultaneously
  • Set and meet deadlines

Title: Business Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Geode Capital Management, LLC is seeking a highly motivated individual who is passionate about investment and engineering. As a Business Analyst, you will become an essential part of our Technology group and will have the opportunity to learn and facilitate the success of our business.

This is a hybrid work environment opportunity located in Boston, Massachusetts with a weekly in office schedule of Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays and remote work availability on Mondays and Fridays.

Responsibilities:


Collaborate closely with business stakeholders, Product managers to establish yourself as a trusted advisor
As part of Geode’s Data team, you will help gather data requirements from business product areas, perform data analysis, help with grooming product backlog and assist the product manager, and maintain product roadmap
Act as a skilled liaison between engineering teams and business stakeholders to extract, gather, analyze, document, communicate, and validate requirements to bridge the gap between technical feasibility and business objectives
Translate your insights and analysis into consumable, engineering-focused documentation to emphasize the 'why' and 'what,' ensuring that the captured information is oriented towards delivering maximum business value
Understand our tools and the best ways to customize them to support our risk-focused business process workflows



Skills You Bring:


5-10 years of experience in financial asset management and technology, ideally working with:
Data Analytics
Data Operations
Data Management
Performance
Trade Operations
Portfolio Management
Strong understanding of Financial Data sets, Data Analysis and Data Management skills
Demonstrate the ability to rapidly assimilate modern technology and technical concepts.
Proven experience working closely with multidisciplinary teams, including seasoned engineers, to deliver exceptional products and solutions
Exhibit excellent written and verbal communication skills by conveying complex product details effortlessly to diverse audiences, fostering clarity and understanding
Familiarity with Jira, Git, Miro, ETL tools, and experience in SQL, data comparison and Data analysis
Display a keen eye for detail, strategically applying it where necessary to ensure precision and accuracy in all endeavors
Embrace a critical thinking mindset, unafraid to pose questions and explore uncertain answers, driving continuous improvement and innovation
Demonstrate proactive problem-solving abilities, capable of independently identifying and resolving challenges. Exhibit curiosity, share solutions and insights collaboratively to benefit the team


Nice to Haves:


Experience with Jira and Confluence
Work directly with end users to understand workflows and needs
Involved in implementation of Data Analytics platforms using Snowflake



Company Overview:

Founded in 2001, Geode is headquartered in Boston’s financial district, the center of one of the world’s most vibrant finance and technology hubs and employs approximately 170 employees.

Geode is an institutional asset manager providing core beta exposures across a range of equity and niche asset classes, with over $1 trillion in AUM as of June 30, 2024. With a robust infrastructure and experienced investment professionals, Geode offers the scale of a large asset management firm with the benefits of a smaller organization.

Geode is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and support a diversified work environment. Learn more about Geode at www.geodecapital.com/careers

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
You know the moment. It’s the first notes of that song you love, the intro to your favorite movie, or simply the sound of someone you love saying “hello.” It’s in these moments that sound matters most.

At Bose, we believe sound is the most powerful force on earth. We’ve dedicated ourselves to improving it for nearly 60 years. And we’re passionate down to our bones about making whatever you’re listening to a little more magical.

At Bose, we are constantly learning and constantly curious. We never stop imagining what better sound sounds like. The Product team leads the transformation of ideas through research, design, development, marketing, and sales, unleashing the transformative power of sound and delivering the best products on the market.

Job Description

About the Role & Team

Bose has an opportunity for a Product Analyst within the Product Quality & Analytics organization in Framingham, Massachusetts. Bose is obsessed with the details that matter to our customers, and the Product Analyst plays a key role in identifying those details for the consumer audio product portfolio.

In this role, and as part of a cross functional product analytics team, you will collaborate closely with our partners in Product Office, Engineering, and Customer Enablement, to quickly turn data into actionable insights. With your proven expertise in finding the story within the data, you will provide clear visibility into that which matters most to our customers across our product and voice of customer data sets. You will leverage a constantly advancing set of analytics tools, to identify and size trends, answer business questions, and inform ongoing reporting and dashboarding needs. You will also provide input into the ongoing improvements of our data collection, models, analytics tools, and application requirements. This is an exciting opportunity to have a direct impact on the quality and delivery of Bose products and services, while learning and working in an innovative and creative environment that spans our entire value chain.

Responsibilities


Identify and size trends across multiple products, app, and voice of customer data sets.
Develop and deliver concise, conclusive answers to business questions, backed by clear and efficient use of data and analytics best practices.
Collaborate with the larger product analytics team to identify, define, and evaluate analytics capability enhancements as needed.


About You


4-year degree (math/analytics focus, advanced degree a plus)
2 years of experience translating data into actionable insights (consumer electronics experience a plus)
Expertise in developing and delivering concise narratives from data.
Proficiency in analytics tools such as SQL/Snowflake, DBT, Power BI/Tableau
Working knowledge of business data collection systems and processes (ex: CRM, Repair, refurbishment, Logistics)
Prior Consumer Electronics or voice of customer analysis experience a plus


Bose is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics. For additional information, please review: (1) the EEO is the Law Poster (http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf); and (2) its Supplements (http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm). Please note, the company's pay transparency is available at http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665_PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguage_JRFQA508c.pdf. Bose is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the application or employment process, please send an e-mail to Wellbeing@bose.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Our goal is to create an atmosphere where every candidate feels supported and empowered in the interviewing process. Diversity and inclusion are integral to our success, and we believe that providing reasonable accommodation is not only a legal obligation but also a fundamental aspect of our commitment to being an employer of choice. We recognize that individuals may have different needs and requirements based on their abilities, and we provide reasonable accommodations to ensure ideal conditions are met during the application process.

If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation, please send a note to wellbeing@bose.com

Title: Analyst, Global Partner Analysis
Description:
About us: 

Bain & Company is a global consultancy that helps the world’s most ambitious change makers define the future. Across 65 offices in 40 countries, we work alongside our clients as one team with a shared ambition to achieve extraordinary results, outperform the competition, and redefine industries. Our 10-year commitment to invest more than $1 billion in pro bono services brings our talent, expertise, and insight to organizations tackling today’s urgent challenges in education, racial equity, social justice, economic development, and the environment. We earned a platinum rating from EcoVadis, the leading platform for environmental, social, and ethical performance ratings for global supply chains, putting us in the top 2% of all companies. Since our founding in 1973, we have measured our success by the success of our clients, and we proudly maintain the highest level of client advocacy in the industry.

We are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world's best places to work, a champion of diversity and a model of social responsibility. We are currently ranked the #1 consulting firm on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work list, and we have maintained a spot in the top four on Glassdoor's list for the last 12 years. We believe that diversity, inclusion and collaboration are key to building extraordinary teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive both professionally and personally.  We are publicly recognized by external parties such as Fortune, Vault, Mogul, Working Mother, Glassdoor and the Human Rights Campaign for being a great place to work for diversity and inclusion, women, LGBTQ and parents.

 

Department overview: 

The Global Partner Analysis (“GPA”) team supports the Worldwide Partner Compensation and Promotion Committee (“CPC”) and drives the global assessment processes for our partner roles across all Bain regions, offices and practices.  The team also leads critical initiatives for the Worldwide Managing Partner, Regional Managing Partners, Chief Leadership Officer, COO, CFO, and Board of Directors. Its members interact on a regular basis with many senior leaders in the firm.

Partners and Expert Partners are the most senior members of the consulting staff at Bain.  They typically have many years of experience leading client engagements, internal roles (offices and client areas of expertise) and are critical to the current and future success of the company.  They act as advisors to senior executives and coaches/mentors to generations of developing Bain consultants. 

Over the past 5+ years, Bain has invested into establishing a new partner role (‘Expert Partner’), focused on partner-level talent with differentiated skill spikes than generalist partners, while equally accomplished.  As this new talent platform matures, a key focus is to drive greater alignment and integration across our Expert and Generalist Partner talent platforms. This role will sit within the Partner Analysis team but also support the compensation and promotion processes of the Expert Partner program and the Expert  Partner Promotion and Diligence Committee and work to help integrate those processes over time.

Position Summary

This role will be more focused initially on assisting our Expert Partner platform and, over time, more broadly, the integration of our partner talent platforms.

Reporting into the Manager, Partner Analysis, you’ll be working as a member of the Partner Analysis team and collaborate closely with the Expert Partner Program team. You will provide proactive financial analytical support and management information to senior customers in Finance and Line Management, including the Expert Partner Promotion and Diligence Committee, Office Heads, and Regional and Global Finance Management. By gathering information from key business partners and internal systems, you will support the data driven decisions that drive key aspects of Bain’s operations and strategy.

 

Responsibilities & Duties

In partnership with Manager, develop analysis and presentation materials to address and effectively communicate financial and operational issues. Proactively identify key trends and issues relevant to the business. Weigh alternatives and develop recommended solutions to GPA and Expert Program team leadership.
Proactively identify opportunities for operational and performance improvements. Independently design and execute analysis required to address issues, draw conclusions and recommend solutions to GPA and Expert Program team leadership.
Compile and analyze financial information by client and geography to inform and support business decisions of senior Bain leadership and the Compensation and Promotion Committees
Analyze firm and Partner performance, take ownership of financial analysis required in Bain’s Generalist and Expert Partner compensation processes. Work with GPA and Expert Program team leadership to analyze trends and track management stats; present recommendations to team leadership.
Work closely with the team technology groups that run the partner assessment tool called “PAS” and the Expert Partner assessment tool. Prepare and analyze data necessary for both processes.
Own and maintain key Expert Partner Assessment tools, including the Expert Partner Compensation database and Expert Partner performance dashboards, ensuring continuous enhancement of data quality, scalability, and integration with the generalist partner tool suite.
Analyze performance metrics of promotion candidates to align with the Partner and Sr. Partner promotion candidates to ensure global consistency in the promotion committees’ evaluations and help prepare materials for both promotion meetings
Prepare and maintain Excel based models to analyze performance.
Research, analyze and respond to questions raised by office heads, RMPs, the committees and Global/Regional Finance Management
Perform special projects and other duties as assigned.
Support the conversion of financial information currently in excel databases into Tableau dashboards or other enhanced tools, for sharing with GPA and Expert Program team leadership

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration (Finance or Accounting), Math, Economics or related analytic field with high academic achievement
3-5 years progressive experience in a finance or analytical role with quantitative modeling
Excellent quantitative and analytical skills
Strong organizational, planning, project management and problem solving skills
Very strong proficiency with Excel (financial modeling & data aggregation, lookups, macros); proficiency in PowerPoint, Word and Outlook; experience using and creating Tableau dashboards, working knowledge of Alteryx a plus
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, ability to interact with collaborative team and with senior management
Detail-oriented and strong customer service skills
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team; enthusiastic team player
Ability to handle highly confidential information in a professional, mature manner
Prior experience working within a Bain revenue analyst role / Bain revenue knowledge, a plus 

 

Person Specification

Flexible attitude and team approach
“Can do!” mentality
Proficient organization, prioritization and time management skills
Strong attention to detail
Able to work on own initiative - and be proactive
Enthusiastic, dedicated, hardworking and committed to meeting deadlines
Thorough approach to completing tasks 
Team-oriented, willing to help out across the team and calm even when under pressure
Show more
